                     <div class="line">You make fat rascals, Mistress Doll.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I make them! gluttony and diseases make them; I</div>
                     <div class="line">make them not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">If the cook help to make the gluttony, you help to</div>
                     <div class="line">make the diseases, Doll: we catch of you, Doll, we</div>
                     <div class="line">catch of you; grant that, my poor virtue grant that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, joy, our chains and our jewels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Your broaches, pearls, and ouches:' for to serve</div>
                     <div class="line">bravely is to come halting off, you know: to come</div>
                     <div class="line">off the breach with his pike bent bravely, and to</div>
                     <div class="line">surgery bravely; to venture upon the charged</div>
                     <div class="line">chambers bravely,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang yourself, you muddy conger, hang yourself!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, this is the old fashion; you two never</div>
                     <div class="line">meet but you fall to some discord: you are both,</div>
                     <div class="line">i' good truth, as rheumatic as two dry toasts; you</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot one bear with another's confirmities. What</div>
                     <div class="line">the good-year! one must bear, and that must be</div>
                     <div class="line">you: you are the weaker vessel, as they say, the</div>
                     <div class="line">emptier vessel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Can a weak empty vessel bear such a huge full</div>
                     <div class="line">hogshead? there's a whole merchant's venture of</div>
                     <div class="line">Bourdeaux stuff in him; you have not seen a hulk</div>
                     <div class="line">better stuffed in the hold. Come, I'll be friends</div>
                     <div class="line">with thee, Jack: thou art going to the wars; and</div>
                     <div class="line">whether I shall ever see thee again or no, there is</div>
                     <div class="line">nobody cares.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter First Drawer</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Drawer</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, Ancient Pistol's below, and would speak with</div>
                     <div class="line">you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang him, swaggering rascal! let him not come</div>
                     <div class="line">hither: it is the foul-mouthed'st rogue in England.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">If he swagger, let him not come here: no, by my</div>
                     <div class="line">faith; I must live among my neighbours: I'll no</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggerers: I am in good name and fame with the</div>
                     <div class="line">very best: shut the door; there comes no swaggerers</div>
                     <div class="line">here: I have not lived all this while, to have</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggering now: shut the door, I pray you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou hear, hostess?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray ye, pacify yourself, Sir John: there comes no</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggerers here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou hear? it is mine ancient.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Tilly-fally, Sir John, ne'er tell me: your ancient</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggerer comes not in my doors. I was before Master</div>
                     <div class="line">Tisick, the debuty, t'other day; and, as he said to</div>
                     <div class="line">me, 'twas no longer ago than Wednesday last, 'I'</div>
                     <div class="line">good faith, neighbour Quickly,' says he; Master</div>
                     <div class="line">Dumbe, our minister, was by then; 'neighbour</div>
                     <div class="line">Quickly,' says he, 'receive those that are civil;</div>
                     <div class="line">for,' said he, 'you are in an ill name:' now a'</div>
                     <div class="line">said so, I can tell whereupon; 'for,' says he, 'you</div>
                     <div class="line">are an honest woman, and well thought on; therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">take heed what guests you receive: receive,' says</div>
                     <div class="line">he, 'no swaggering companions.' There comes none</div>
                     <div class="line">here: you would bless you to hear what he said:</div>
                     <div class="line">no, I'll no swaggerers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">He's no swaggerer, hostess; a tame cheater, i'</div>
                     <div class="line">faith; you may stroke him as gently as a puppy</div>
                     <div class="line">greyhound: he'll not swagger with a Barbary hen, if</div>
                     <div class="line">her feathers turn back in any show of resistance.</div>
                     <div class="line">Call him up, drawer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit First Drawer</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Cheater, call you him? I will bar no honest man my</div>
                     <div class="line">house, nor no cheater: but I do not love</div>
                     <div class="line">swaggering, by my troth; I am the worse, when one</div>
                     <div class="line">says swagger: feel, masters, how I shake; look you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">So you do, hostess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Do I? yea, in very truth, do I, an 'twere an aspen</div>
                     <div class="line">leaf: I cannot abide swaggerers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PISTOL, BARDOLPH, and Page</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">God save you, Sir John!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Ancient Pistol. Here, Pistol, I charge</div>
                     <div class="line">you with a cup of sack: do you discharge upon mine hostess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">I will discharge upon her, Sir John, with two bullets.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">She is Pistol-proof, sir; you shall hardly offend</div>
                     <div class="line">her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I'll drink no proofs nor no bullets: I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">drink no more than will do me good, for no man's</div>
                     <div class="line">pleasure, I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Then to you, Mistress Dorothy; I will charge you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Charge me! I scorn you, scurvy companion. What!</div>
                     <div class="line">you poor, base, rascally, cheating, lack-linen</div>
                     <div class="line">mate! Away, you mouldy rogue, away! I am meat for</div>
                     <div class="line">your master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you, Mistress Dorothy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, you cut-purse rascal! you filthy bung, away!</div>
                     <div class="line">by this wine, I'll thrust my knife in your mouldy</div>
                     <div class="line">chaps, an you play the saucy cuttle with me. Away,</div>
                     <div class="line">you bottle-ale rascal! you basket-hilt stale</div>
                     <div class="line">juggler, you! Since when, I pray you, sir? God's</div>
                     <div class="line">light, with two points on your shoulder? much!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">God let me not live, but I will murder your ruff for this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, Pistol; I would not have you go off here:</div>
                     <div class="line">discharge yourself of our company, Pistol.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Good Captain Pistol; not here, sweet captain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Captain! thou abominable damned cheater, art thou</div>
                     <div class="line">not ashamed to be called captain? An captains were</div>
                     <div class="line">of my mind, they would truncheon you out, for</div>
                     <div class="line">taking their names upon you before you have earned</div>
                     <div class="line">them. You a captain! you slave, for what? for</div>
                     <div class="line">tearing a poor whore's ruff in a bawdy-house? He a</div>
                     <div class="line">captain! hang him, rogue! he lives upon mouldy</div>
                     <div class="line">stewed prunes and dried cakes. A captain! God's</div>
                     <div class="line">light, these villains will make the word as odious</div>
                     <div class="line">as the word 'occupy;' which was an excellent good</div>
                     <div class="line">word before it was ill sorted: therefore captains</div>
                     <div class="line">had need look to 't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray thee, go down, good ancient.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark thee hither, Mistress Doll.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I I tell thee what, Corporal Bardolph, I could</div>
                     <div class="line">tear her: I'll be revenged of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray thee, go down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll see her damned first; to Pluto's damned lake,</div>
                     <div class="line">by this hand, to the infernal deep, with Erebus and</div>
                     <div class="line">tortures vile also. Hold hook and line, say I.</div>
                     <div class="line">Down, down, dogs! down, faitors! Have we not</div>
                     <div class="line">Hiren here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Captain Peesel, be quiet; 'tis very late, i'</div>
                     <div class="line">faith: I beseek you now, aggravate your choler.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">These be good humours, indeed! Shall pack-horses</div>
                     <div class="line">And hollow pamper'd jades of Asia,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which cannot go but thirty mile a-day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Compare with Caesars, and with Cannibals,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Trojan Greeks? nay, rather damn them with</div>
                     <div class="line">King Cerberus; and let the welkin roar.</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we fall foul for toys?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, captain, these are very bitter words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Be gone, good ancient: this will grow to abrawl anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Die men like dogs! give crowns like pins! Have we</div>
                     <div class="line">not Heren here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">O' my word, captain, there's none such here. What</div>
                     <div class="line">the good-year! do you think I would deny her? For</div>
                     <div class="line">God's sake, be quiet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Then feed, and be fat, my fair Calipolis.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, give's some sack.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Si fortune me tormente, sperato me contento.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear we broadsides? no, let the fiend give fire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me some sack: and, sweetheart, lie thou there.</div>
                     <p>Laying down his sword</p>
                     <div class="line">Come we to full points here; and are etceteras nothing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Pistol, I would be quiet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet knight, I kiss thy neaf: what! we have seen</div>
                     <div class="line">the seven stars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's sake, thrust him down stairs: I cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">endure such a fustian rascal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrust him down stairs! know we not Galloway nags?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Quoit him down, Bardolph, like a shove-groat</div>
                     <div class="line">shilling: nay, an a' do nothing but speak nothing,</div>
                     <div class="line">a' shall be nothing here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, get you down stairs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                     <div class="line">What! shall we have incision? shall we imbrue?</div>
                     <p>Snatching up his sword</p>
                     <div class="line">Then death rock me asleep, abridge my doleful days!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, let grievous, ghastly, gaping wounds</div>
                     <div class="line">Untwine the Sisters Three! Come, Atropos, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's goodly stuff toward!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my rapier, boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, Jack, I pray thee, do not draw.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Get you down stairs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drawing, and driving PISTOL out</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a goodly tumult! I'll forswear keeping</div>
                     <div class="line">house, afore I'll be in these tirrits and frights.</div>
                     <div class="line">So; murder, I warrant now. Alas, alas! put up</div>
                     <div class="line">your naked weapons, put up your naked weapons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PISTOL and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, Jack, be quiet; the rascal's gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, you whoreson little valiant villain, you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">He you not hurt i' the groin? methought a' made a</div>
                     <div class="line">shrewd thrust at your belly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you turned him out o' doors?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, sir. The rascal's drunk: you have hurt him,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, i' the shoulder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A rascal! to brave me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, you sweet little rogue, you! alas, poor ape,</div>
                     <div class="line">how thou sweatest! come, let me wipe thy face;</div>
                     <div class="line">come on, you whoreson chops: ah, rogue! i'faith, I</div>
                     <div class="line">love thee: thou art as valorous as Hector of Troy,</div>
                     <div class="line">worth five of Agamemnon, and ten times better than</div>
                     <div class="line">the Nine Worthies: ah, villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A rascally slave! I will toss the rogue in a blanket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, an thou darest for thy heart: an thou dost,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll canvass thee between a pair of sheets.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Music</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">The music is come, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them play. Play, sirs. Sit on my knee, Doll.</div>
                     <div class="line">A rascal bragging slave! the rogue fled from me</div>
                     <div class="line">like quicksilver.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I' faith, and thou followedst him like a church.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou whoreson little tidy Bartholomew boar-pig,</div>
                     <div class="line">when wilt thou leave fighting o' days and foining</div>
                     <div class="line">o' nights, and begin to patch up thine old body for heaven?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, behind, PRINCE HENRY and POINS, disguised</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, good Doll! do not speak like a death's-head;</div>
                     <div class="line">do not bid me remember mine end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, what humour's the prince of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A good shallow young fellow: a' would have made a</div>
                     <div class="line">good pantler, a' would ha' chipp'd bread well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">They say Poins has a good wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">He a good wit? hang him, baboon! his wit's as thick</div>
                     <div class="line">as Tewksbury mustard; there's no more conceit in him</div>
                     <div class="line">than is in a mallet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why does the prince love him so, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Because their legs are both of a bigness, and a'</div>
                     <div class="line">plays at quoits well, and eats conger and fennel,</div>
                     <div class="line">and drinks off candles' ends for flap-dragons, and</div>
                     <div class="line">rides the wild-mare with the boys, and jumps upon</div>
                     <div class="line">joined-stools, and swears with a good grace, and</div>
                     <div class="line">wears his boots very smooth, like unto the sign of</div>
                     <div class="line">the leg, and breeds no bate with telling of discreet</div>
                     <div class="line">stories; and such other gambol faculties a' has,</div>
                     <div class="line">that show a weak mind and an able body, for the</div>
                     <div class="line">which the prince admits him: for the prince himself</div>
                     <div class="line">is such another; the weight of a hair will turn the</div>
                     <div class="line">scales between their avoirdupois.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Would not this nave of a wheel have his ears cut off?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's beat him before his whore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, whether the withered elder hath not his poll</div>
                     <div class="line">clawed like a parrot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not strange that desire should so many years</div>
                     <div class="line">outlive performance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Kiss me, Doll.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Saturn and Venus this year in conjunction! what</div>
                     <div class="line">says the almanac to that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">And look, whether the fiery Trigon, his man, be not</div>
                     <div class="line">lisping to his master's old tables, his note-book,</div>
                     <div class="line">his counsel-keeper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost give me flattering busses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I kiss thee with a most constant heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I am old, I am old.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee better than I love e'er a scurvy young</div>
                     <div class="line">boy of them all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What stuff wilt have a kirtle of? I shall receive</div>
                     <div class="line">money o' Thursday: shalt have a cap to-morrow. A</div>
                     <div class="line">merry song, come: it grows late; we'll to bed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou'lt forget me when I am gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, thou'lt set me a-weeping, an thou</div>
                     <div class="line">sayest so: prove that ever I dress myself handsome</div>
                     <div class="line">till thy return: well, harken at the end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Some sack, Francis.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Coming forward</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! a bastard son of the king's? And art not thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Poins his brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thou globe of sinful continents! what a life</div>
                     <div class="line">dost thou lead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">A better than thou: I am a gentleman; thou art a drawer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Very true, sir; and I come to draw you out by the ears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">O, the Lord preserve thy good grace! by my troth,</div>
                     <div class="line">welcome to London. Now, the Lord bless that sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">face of thine! O, Jesu, are you come from Wales?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou whoreson mad compound of majesty, by this light</div>
                     <div class="line">flesh and corrupt blood, thou art welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">How, you fat fool! I scorn you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, he will drive you out of your revenge and</div>
                     <div class="line">turn all to a merriment, if you take not the heat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">You whoreson candle-mine, you, how vilely did you</div>
                     <div class="line">speak of me even now before this honest, virtuous,</div>
                     <div class="line">civil gentlewoman!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">God's blessing of your good heart! and so she is,</div>
                     <div class="line">by my troth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou hear me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, and you knew me, as you did when you ran away</div>
                     <div class="line">by Gad's-hill: you knew I was at your back, and</div>
                     <div class="line">spoke it on purpose to try my patience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, no; not so; I did not think thou wast within hearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall drive you then to confess the wilful abuse;</div>
                     <div class="line">and then I know how to handle you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No abuse, Hal, o' mine honour, no abuse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to dispraise me, and call me pantier and</div>
                     <div class="line">bread-chipper and I know not what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No abuse, Hal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">No abuse?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No abuse, Ned, i' the world; honest Ned, none. I</div>
                     <div class="line">dispraised him before the wicked, that the wicked</div>
                     <div class="line">might not fall in love with him; in which doing, I</div>
                     <div class="line">have done the part of a careful friend and a true</div>
                     <div class="line">subject, and thy father is to give me thanks for it.</div>
                     <div class="line">No abuse, Hal: none, Ned, none: no, faith, boys, none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">See now, whether pure fear and entire cowardice doth</div>
                     <div class="line">not make thee wrong this virtuous gentlewoman to</div>
                     <div class="line">close with us? is she of the wicked? is thine</div>
                     <div class="line">hostess here of the wicked? or is thy boy of the</div>
                     <div class="line">wicked? or honest Bardolph, whose zeal burns in his</div>
                     <div class="line">nose, of the wicked?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">POINS</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer, thou dead elm, answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">The fiend hath pricked down Bardolph irrecoverable;</div>
                     <div class="line">and his face is Lucifer's privy-kitchen, where he</div>
                     <div class="line">doth nothing but roast malt-worms. For the boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">there is a good angel about him; but the devil</div>
                     <div class="line">outbids him too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">For the women?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">For one of them, she is in hell already, and burns</div>
                     <div class="line">poor souls. For the other, I owe her money, and</div>
                     <div class="line">whether she be damned for that, I know not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I think thou art not; I think thou art quit for</div>
                     <div class="line">that. Marry, there is another indictment upon thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">for suffering flesh to be eaten in thy house,</div>
                     <div class="line">contrary to the law; for the which I think thou wilt howl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">All victuallers do so; what's a joint of mutton or</div>
                     <div class="line">two in a whole Lent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">You, gentlewoman,-</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">What says your grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">His grace says that which his flesh rebels against.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Knocking within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Who knocks so loud at door? Look to the door there, Francis.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PETO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">Peto, how now! what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETO</div>
                     <div class="line">The king your father is at Westminster:</div>
                     <div class="line">And there are twenty weak and wearied posts</div>
                     <div class="line">Come from the north: and, as I came along,</div>
                     <div class="line">I met and overtook a dozen captains,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bare-headed, sweating, knocking at the taverns,</div>
                     <div class="line">And asking every one for Sir John Falstaff.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, Poins, I feel me much to blame,</div>
                     <div class="line">So idly to profane the precious time,</div>
                     <div class="line">When tempest of commotion, like the south</div>
                     <div class="line">Borne with black vapour, doth begin to melt</div>
                     <div class="line">And drop upon our bare unarmed heads.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my sword and cloak. Falstaff, good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PRINCE HENRY, POINS, PETO and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Now comes in the sweetest morsel of the night, and</div>
                     <div class="line">we must hence and leave it unpicked.</div>
                     <p>Knocking within</p>
                     <div class="line">More knocking at the door!</div>
                     <p>Re-enter BARDOLPH</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">You must away to court, sir, presently;</div>
                     <div class="line">A dozen captains stay at door for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To the Page</span>  Pay the musicians, sirrah. Farewell,</div>
                     <div class="line">hostess; farewell, Doll. You see, my good wenches,</div>
                     <div class="line">how men of merit are sought after: the undeserver</div>
                     <div class="line">may sleep, when the man of action is called on.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell good wenches: if I be not sent away post,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will see you again ere I go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot speak; if my heart be not read to burst,--</div>
                     <div class="line">well, sweet Jack, have a care of thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt FALSTAFF and BARDOLPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, fare thee well: I have known thee these</div>
                     <div class="line">twenty-nine years, come peascod-time; but an</div>
                     <div class="line">honester and truer-hearted man,--well, fare thee well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Mistress Tearsheet!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">What's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Good Mistress Tearsheet, come to my master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                     <div class="line">O, run, Doll, run; run, good Doll: come.</div>
                     <p>She comes blubbered</p>
                     <div class="line">Yea, will you come, Doll?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Westminster. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Gloucestershire. Before SHALLOW'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Westminster. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY IV in his nightgown, with a Page</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Go call the Earls of Surrey and of Warwick;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, ere they come, bid them o'er-read these letters,</div>
                     <div class="line">And well consider of them; make good speed.</div>
                     <p>Exit Page</p>
                     <div class="line">How many thousand of my poorest subjects</div>
                     <div class="line">Are at this hour asleep! O sleep, O gentle sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature's soft nurse, how have I frighted thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou no more wilt weigh my eyelids down</div>
                     <div class="line">And steep my senses in forgetfulness?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why rather, sleep, liest thou in smoky cribs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon uneasy pallets stretching thee</div>
                     <div class="line">And hush'd with buzzing night-flies to thy slumber,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in the perfumed chambers of the great,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the canopies of costly state,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lull'd with sound of sweetest melody?</div>
                     <div class="line">O thou dull god, why liest thou with the vile</div>
                     <div class="line">In loathsome beds, and leavest the kingly couch</div>
                     <div class="line">A watch-case or a common 'larum-bell?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou upon the high and giddy mast</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal up the ship-boy's eyes, and rock his brains</div>
                     <div class="line">In cradle of the rude imperious surge</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the visitation of the winds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who take the ruffian billows by the top,</div>
                     <div class="line">Curling their monstrous heads and hanging them</div>
                     <div class="line">With deafening clamour in the slippery clouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, with the hurly, death itself awakes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Canst thou, O partial sleep, give thy repose</div>
                     <div class="line">To the wet sea-boy in an hour so rude,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the calmest and most stillest night,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all appliances and means to boot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deny it to a king? Then happy low, lie down!</div>
                     <div class="line">Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter WARWICK and SURREY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">Many good morrows to your majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it good morrow, lords?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis one o'clock, and past.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, good morrow to you all, my lords.</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you read o'er the letters that I sent you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">We have, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you perceive the body of our kingdom</div>
                     <div class="line">How foul it is; what rank diseases grow</div>
                     <div class="line">And with what danger, near the heart of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">It is but as a body yet distemper'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which to his former strength may be restored</div>
                     <div class="line">With good advice and little medicine:</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord Northumberland will soon be cool'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">O God! that one might read the book of fate,</div>
                     <div class="line">And see the revolution of the times</div>
                     <div class="line">Make mountains level, and the continent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Weary of solid firmness, melt itself</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the sea! and, other times, to see</div>
                     <div class="line">The beachy girdle of the ocean</div>
                     <div class="line">Too wide for Neptune's hips; how chances mock,</div>
                     <div class="line">And changes fill the cup of alteration</div>
                     <div class="line">With divers liquors! O, if this were seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">The happiest youth, viewing his progress through,</div>
                     <div class="line">What perils past, what crosses to ensue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would shut the book, and sit him down and die.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not 'ten years gone</div>
                     <div class="line">Since Richard and Northumberland, great friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did feast together, and in two years after</div>
                     <div class="line">Were they at wars: it is but eight years since</div>
                     <div class="line">This Percy was the man nearest my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who like a brother toil'd in my affairs</div>
                     <div class="line">And laid his love and life under my foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, for my sake, even to the eyes of Richard</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave him defiance. But which of you was by--</div>
                     <div class="line">You, cousin Nevil, as I may remember--</div>
                     <p>To WARWICK</p>
                     <div class="line">When Richard, with his eye brimful of tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then cheque'd and rated by Northumberland,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did speak these words, now proved a prophecy?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Northumberland, thou ladder by the which</div>
                     <div class="line">My cousin Bolingbroke ascends my throne;'</div>
                     <div class="line">Though then, God knows, I had no such intent,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that necessity so bow'd the state</div>
                     <div class="line">That I and greatness were compell'd to kiss:</div>
                     <div class="line">'The time shall come,' thus did he follow it,</div>
                     <div class="line">'The time will come, that foul sin, gathering head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall break into corruption:' so went on,</div>
                     <div class="line">Foretelling this same time's condition</div>
                     <div class="line">And the division of our amity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a history in all men's lives,</div>
                     <div class="line">Figuring the nature of the times deceased;</div>
                     <div class="line">The which observed, a man may prophesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">With a near aim, of the main chance of things</div>
                     <div class="line">As yet not come to life, which in their seeds</div>
                     <div class="line">And weak beginnings lie intreasured.</div>
                     <div class="line">Such things become the hatch and brood of time;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the necessary form of this</div>
                     <div class="line">King Richard might create a perfect guess</div>
                     <div class="line">That great Northumberland, then false to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would of that seed grow to a greater falseness;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which should not find a ground to root upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless on you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">Are these things then necessities?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let us meet them like necessities:</div>
                     <div class="line">And that same word even now cries out on us:</div>
                     <div class="line">They say the bishop and Northumberland</div>
                     <div class="line">Are fifty thousand strong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rumour doth double, like the voice and echo,</div>
                     <div class="line">The numbers of the fear'd. Please it your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">To go to bed. Upon my soul, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The powers that you already have sent forth</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall bring this prize in very easily.</div>
                     <div class="line">To comfort you the more, I have received</div>
                     <div class="line">A certain instance that Glendower is dead.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your majesty hath been this fortnight ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">And these unseason'd hours perforce must add</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto your sickness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                     <div class="line">I will take your counsel:</div>
                     <div class="line">And were these inward wars once out of hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">We would, dear lords, unto the Holy Land.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Gloucestershire. Before SHALLOW'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SHALLOW and SILENCE, meeting; MOULDY,
SHADOW, WART, FEEBLE, BULLCALF, a Servant or two
with them</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, come on, come on, sir; give me your hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, give me your hand, sir: an early stirrer, by</div>
                     <div class="line">the rood! And how doth my good cousin Silence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, good cousin Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">And how doth my cousin, your bedfellow? and your</div>
                     <div class="line">fairest daughter and mine, my god-daughter Ellen?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, a black ousel, cousin Shallow!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">By yea and nay, sir, I dare say my cousin William is</div>
                     <div class="line">become a good scholar: he is at Oxford still, is he not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, sir, to my cost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">A' must, then, to the inns o' court shortly. I was</div>
                     <div class="line">once of Clement's Inn, where I think they will</div>
                     <div class="line">talk of mad Shallow yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You were called 'lusty Shallow' then, cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">By the mass, I was called any thing; and I would</div>
                     <div class="line">have done any thing indeed too, and roundly too.</div>
                     <div class="line">There was I, and little John Doit of Staffordshire,</div>
                     <div class="line">and black George Barnes, and Francis Pickbone, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Will Squele, a Cotswold man; you had not four such</div>
                     <div class="line">swinge-bucklers in all the inns o' court again: and</div>
                     <div class="line">I may say to you, we knew where the bona-robas were</div>
                     <div class="line">and had the best of them all at commandment. Then</div>
                     <div class="line">was Jack Falstaff, now Sir John, a boy, and page to</div>
                     <div class="line">Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">This Sir John, cousin, that comes hither anon about soldiers?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">The same Sir John, the very same. I  see him break</div>
                     <div class="line">Skogan's head at the court-gate, when a' was a</div>
                     <div class="line">crack not thus high: and the very same day did I</div>
                     <div class="line">fight with one Sampson Stockfish, a fruiterer,</div>
                     <div class="line">behind Gray's Inn. Jesu, Jesu, the mad days that I</div>
                     <div class="line">have spent! and to see how many of my old</div>
                     <div class="line">acquaintance are dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall all follow, cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHADOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Certain, 'tis certain; very sure, very sure: death,</div>
                     <div class="line">as the Psalmist saith, is certain to all; all shall</div>
                     <div class="line">die. How a good yoke of bullocks at Stamford fair?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I was not there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Death is certain. Is old Double of your town living</div>
                     <div class="line">yet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Jesu, Jesu, dead! a' drew a good bow; and dead! a'</div>
                     <div class="line">shot a fine shoot: John a Gaunt loved him well, and</div>
                     <div class="line">betted much money on his head. Dead! a' would have</div>
                     <div class="line">clapped i' the clout at twelve score; and carried</div>
                     <div class="line">you a forehand shaft a fourteen and fourteen and a</div>
                     <div class="line">half, that it would have done a man's heart good to</div>
                     <div class="line">see. How a score of ewes now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thereafter as they be: a score of good ewes may be</div>
                     <div class="line">worth ten pounds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">And is old Double dead?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come two of Sir John Falstaff's men, as I think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BARDOLPH and one with him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, honest gentlemen: I beseech you, which</div>
                     <div class="line">is Justice Shallow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">I am Robert Shallow, sir; a poor esquire of this</div>
                     <div class="line">county, and one of the king's justices of the peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your good pleasure with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">My captain, sir, commends him to you; my captain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John Falstaff, a tall gentleman, by heaven, and</div>
                     <div class="line">a most gallant leader.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">He greets me well, sir. I knew him a good backsword</div>
                     <div class="line">man. How doth the good knight? may I ask how my</div>
                     <div class="line">lady his wife doth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, pardon; a soldier is better accommodated than</div>
                     <div class="line">with a wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">It is well said, in faith, sir; and it is well said</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed too. Better accommodated! it is good; yea,</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed, is it: good phrases are surely, and ever</div>
                     <div class="line">were, very commendable. Accommodated! it comes of</div>
                     <div class="line">'accommodo' very good; a good phrase.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, sir; I have heard the word. Phrase call</div>
                     <div class="line">you it? by this good day, I know not the phrase;</div>
                     <div class="line">but I will maintain the word with my sword to be a</div>
                     <div class="line">soldier-like word, and a word of exceeding good</div>
                     <div class="line">command, by heaven. Accommodated; that is, when a</div>
                     <div class="line">man is, as they say, accommodated; or when a man is,</div>
