                     <div class="line">being, whereby a' may be thought to be accommodated;</div>
                     <div class="line">which is an excellent thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">It is very just.</div>
                     <p>Enter FALSTAFF</p>
                     <div class="line">Look, here comes good Sir John. Give me your good</div>
                     <div class="line">hand, give me your worship's good hand: by my</div>
                     <div class="line">troth, you like well and bear your years very well:</div>
                     <div class="line">welcome, good Sir John.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad to see you well, good Master Robert</div>
                     <div class="line">Shallow: Master Surecard, as I think?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">No, Sir John; it is my cousin Silence, in commission with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Silence, it well befits you should be of</div>
                     <div class="line">the peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your good-worship is welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie! this is hot weather, gentlemen. Have you</div>
                     <div class="line">provided me here half a dozen sufficient men?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, have we, sir. Will you sit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me see them, I beseech you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's the roll? where's the roll? where's the</div>
                     <div class="line">roll? Let me see, let me see, let me see. So, so:</div>
                     <div class="line">yea, marry, sir: Ralph Mouldy! Let them appear as</div>
                     <div class="line">I call; let them do so, let them do so. Let me</div>
                     <div class="line">see; where is Mouldy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOULDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, an't please you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">What think you, Sir John? a good-limbed fellow;</div>
                     <div class="line">young, strong, and of good friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Is thy name Mouldy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOULDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, an't please you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis the more time thou wert used.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha, ha! most excellent, i' faith! Things that</div>
                     <div class="line">are mouldy lack use: very singular good! in faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">well said, Sir John, very well said.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Prick him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOULDY</div>
                     <div class="line">I was pricked well enough before, an you could have</div>
                     <div class="line">let me alone: my old dame will be undone now for</div>
                     <div class="line">one to do her husbandry and her drudgery: you need</div>
                     <div class="line">not to have pricked me; there are other men fitter</div>
                     <div class="line">to go out than I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to: peace, Mouldy; you shall go. Mouldy, it is</div>
                     <div class="line">time you were spent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOULDY</div>
                     <div class="line">Spent!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, fellow, peace; stand aside: know you where</div>
                     <div class="line">you are? For the other, Sir John: let me see:</div>
                     <div class="line">Simon Shadow!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, marry, let me have him to sit under: he's like</div>
                     <div class="line">to be a cold soldier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Shadow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHADOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Shadow, whose son art thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHADOW</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother's son, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mother's son! like enough, and thy father's</div>
                     <div class="line">shadow: so the son of the female is the shadow of</div>
                     <div class="line">the male: it is often so, indeed; but much of the</div>
                     <div class="line">father's substance!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you like him, Sir John?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Shadow will serve for summer; prick him, for we have</div>
                     <div class="line">a number of shadows to fill up the muster-book.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Thomas Wart!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WART</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Is thy name Wart?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WART</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a very ragged wart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I prick him down, Sir John?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">It were superfluous; for his apparel is built upon</div>
                     <div class="line">his back and the whole frame stands upon pins:</div>
                     <div class="line">prick him no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha, ha! you can do it, sir; you can do it: I</div>
                     <div class="line">commend you well. Francis Feeble!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What trade art thou, Feeble?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman's tailor, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I prick him, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">You may: but if he had been a man's tailor, he'ld</div>
                     <div class="line">ha' pricked you. Wilt thou make as many holes in</div>
                     <div class="line">an enemy's battle as thou hast done in a woman's petticoat?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will do my good will, sir; you can have no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, good woman's tailor! well said,</div>
                     <div class="line">courageous Feeble! thou wilt be as valiant as the</div>
                     <div class="line">wrathful dove or most magnanimous mouse. Prick the</div>
                     <div class="line">woman's tailor: well, Master Shallow; deep, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would Wart might have gone, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I would thou wert a man's tailor, that thou mightst</div>
                     <div class="line">mend him and make him fit to go. I cannot put him</div>
                     <div class="line">to a private soldier that is the leader of so many</div>
                     <div class="line">thousands: let that suffice, most forcible Feeble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall suffice, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">I am bound to thee, reverend Feeble. Who is next?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Peter Bullcalf o' the green!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, marry, let's see Bullcalf.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BULLCALF</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fore God, a likely fellow! Come, prick me Bullcalf</div>
                     <div class="line">till he roar again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BULLCALF</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord! good my lord captain,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What, dost thou roar before thou art pricked?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BULLCALF</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, sir! I am a diseased man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">What disease hast thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BULLCALF</div>
                     <div class="line">A whoreson cold, sir, a cough, sir, which I caught</div>
                     <div class="line">with ringing in the king's affairs upon his</div>
                     <div class="line">coronation-day, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, thou shalt go to the wars in a gown; we wilt</div>
                     <div class="line">have away thy cold; and I will take such order that</div>
                     <div class="line">my friends shall ring for thee. Is here all?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is two more called than your number, you must</div>
                     <div class="line">have but four here, sir: and so, I pray you, go in</div>
                     <div class="line">with me to dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I will go drink with you, but I cannot tarry</div>
                     <div class="line">dinner. I am glad to see you, by my troth, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">O, Sir John, do you remember since we lay all night</div>
                     <div class="line">in the windmill in Saint George's field?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">No more of that, good Master Shallow, no more of that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! 'twas a merry night. And is Jane Nightwork alive?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">She lives, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">She never could away with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Never, never; she would always say she could not</div>
                     <div class="line">abide Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">By the mass, I could anger her to the heart. She</div>
                     <div class="line">was then a bona-roba. Doth she hold her own well?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Old, old, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, she must be old; she cannot choose but be old;</div>
                     <div class="line">certain she's old; and had Robin Nightwork by old</div>
                     <div class="line">Nightwork before I came to Clement's Inn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's fifty-five year ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, cousin Silence, that thou hadst seen that that</div>
                     <div class="line">this knight and I have seen! Ha, Sir John, said I well?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">We have heard the chimes at midnight, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">That we have, that we have, that we have; in faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John, we have: our watch-word was 'Hem boys!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's to dinner; come, let's to dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">Jesus, the days that we have seen! Come, come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt FALSTAFF and Justices</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BULLCALF</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Master Corporate Bardolph, stand my friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">and here's four Harry ten shillings in French crowns</div>
                     <div class="line">for you. In very truth, sir, I had as lief be</div>
                     <div class="line">hanged, sir, as go: and yet, for mine own part, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not care; but rather, because I am unwilling,</div>
                     <div class="line">and, for mine own part, have a desire to stay with</div>
                     <div class="line">my friends; else, sir, I did not care, for mine own</div>
                     <div class="line">part, so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; stand aside.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOULDY</div>
                     <div class="line">And, good master corporal captain, for my old</div>
                     <div class="line">dame's sake, stand my friend: she has nobody to do</div>
                     <div class="line">any thing about her when I am gone; and she is old,</div>
                     <div class="line">and cannot help herself: You shall have forty, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; stand aside.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, I care not; a man can die but once: we</div>
                     <div class="line">owe God a death: I'll ne'er bear a base mind:</div>
                     <div class="line">an't be my destiny, so; an't be not, so: no man is</div>
                     <div class="line">too good to serve's prince; and let it go which way</div>
                     <div class="line">it will, he that dies this year is quit for the next.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said; thou'rt a good fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FEEBLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I'll bear no base mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter FALSTAFF and the Justices</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, which men shall I have?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Four of which you please.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, a word with you: I have three pound to free</div>
                     <div class="line">Mouldy and Bullcalf.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Sir John, which four will you have?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you choose for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, then, Mouldy, Bullcalf, Feeble and Shadow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Mouldy and Bullcalf: for you, Mouldy, stay at home</div>
                     <div class="line">till you are past service: and for your part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bullcalf, grow till you come unto it: I will none of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John, Sir John, do not yourself wrong: they are</div>
                     <div class="line">your likeliest men, and I would have you served with the best.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you tell me, Master Shallow, how to choose a</div>
                     <div class="line">man? Care I for the limb, the thewes, the stature,</div>
                     <div class="line">bulk, and big assemblance of a man! Give me the</div>
                     <div class="line">spirit, Master Shallow. Here's Wart; you see what a</div>
                     <div class="line">ragged appearance it is; a' shall charge you and</div>
                     <div class="line">discharge you with the motion of a pewterer's</div>
                     <div class="line">hammer, come off and on swifter than he that gibbets</div>
                     <div class="line">on the brewer's bucket. And this same half-faced</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow, Shadow; give me this man: he presents no</div>
                     <div class="line">mark to the enemy; the foeman may with as great aim</div>
                     <div class="line">level at the edge of a penknife. And for a retreat;</div>
                     <div class="line">how swiftly will this Feeble the woman's tailor run</div>
                     <div class="line">off! O, give me the spare men, and spare me the</div>
                     <div class="line">great ones. Put me a caliver into Wart's hand, Bardolph.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, Wart, traverse; thus, thus, thus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, manage me your caliver. So: very well: go</div>
                     <div class="line">to: very good, exceeding good. O, give me always a</div>
                     <div class="line">little, lean, old, chapt, bald shot. Well said, i'</div>
                     <div class="line">faith, Wart; thou'rt a good scab: hold, there's a</div>
                     <div class="line">tester for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">He is not his craft's master; he doth not do it</div>
                     <div class="line">right. I remember at Mile-end Green, when I lay at</div>
                     <div class="line">Clement's Inn--I was then Sir Dagonet in Arthur's</div>
                     <div class="line">show,--there was a little quiver fellow, and a'</div>
                     <div class="line">would manage you his piece thus; and a' would about</div>
                     <div class="line">and about, and come you in and come you in: 'rah,</div>
                     <div class="line">tah, tah,' would a' say; 'bounce' would a' say; and</div>
                     <div class="line">away again would a' go, and again would a' come: I</div>
                     <div class="line">shall ne'er see such a fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">These fellows will do well, Master Shallow. God</div>
                     <div class="line">keep you, Master Silence: I will not use many words</div>
                     <div class="line">with you. Fare you well, gentlemen both: I thank</div>
                     <div class="line">you: I must a dozen mile to-night. Bardolph, give</div>
                     <div class="line">the soldiers coats.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir John, the Lord bless you! God prosper your</div>
                     <div class="line">affairs! God send us peace! At your return visit</div>
                     <div class="line">our house; let our old acquaintance be renewed;</div>
                     <div class="line">peradventure I will with ye to the court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fore God, I would you would, Master Shallow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; I have spoke at a word. God keep you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well, gentle gentlemen.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt Justices</p>
                     <div class="line">On, Bardolph; lead the men away.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt BARDOLPH, Recruits, &c</p>
                     <div class="line">As I return, I will fetch off these justices: I do</div>
                     <div class="line">see the bottom of Justice Shallow. Lord, Lord, how</div>
                     <div class="line">subject we old men are to this vice of lying! This</div>
                     <div class="line">same starved justice hath done nothing but prate to</div>
                     <div class="line">me of the wildness of his youth, and the feats he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath done about Turnbull Street: and every third</div>
                     <div class="line">word a lie, duer paid to the hearer than the Turk's</div>
                     <div class="line">tribute. I do remember him at Clement's Inn like a</div>
                     <div class="line">man made after supper of a cheese-paring: when a'</div>
                     <div class="line">was naked, he was, for all the world, like a forked</div>
                     <div class="line">radish, with a head fantastically carved upon it</div>
                     <div class="line">with a knife: a' was so forlorn, that his</div>
                     <div class="line">dimensions to any thick sight were invincible: a'</div>
                     <div class="line">was the very genius of famine; yet lecherous as a</div>
                     <div class="line">monkey, and the whores called him mandrake: a' came</div>
                     <div class="line">ever in the rearward of the fashion, and sung those</div>
                     <div class="line">tunes to the overscutched huswives that he heard the</div>
                     <div class="line">carmen whistle, and swear they were his fancies or</div>
                     <div class="line">his good-nights. And now is this Vice's dagger</div>
                     <div class="line">become a squire, and talks as familiarly of John a</div>
                     <div class="line">Gaunt as if he had been sworn brother to him; and</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be sworn a' ne'er saw him but once in the</div>
                     <div class="line">Tilt-yard; and then he burst his head for crowding</div>
                     <div class="line">among the marshal's men. I saw it, and told John a</div>
                     <div class="line">Gaunt he beat his own name; for you might have</div>
                     <div class="line">thrust him and all his apparel into an eel-skin; the</div>
                     <div class="line">case of a treble hautboy was a mansion for him, a</div>
                     <div class="line">court: and now has he land and beefs. Well, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">be acquainted with him, if I return; and it shall</div>
                     <div class="line">go hard but I will make him a philosopher's two</div>
                     <div class="line">stones to me: if the young dace be a bait for the</div>
                     <div class="line">old pike, I see no reason in the law of nature but I</div>
                     <div class="line">may snap at him. Let time shape, and there an end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Yorkshire. Gaultree Forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Another part of the forest.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  Another chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Yorkshire. Gaultree Forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK, MOWBRAY, LORD
HASTINGS, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">What is this forest call'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis Gaultree Forest, an't shall please your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Here stand, my lords; and send discoverers forth</div>
                     <div class="line">To know the numbers of our enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">We have sent forth already.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis well done.</div>
                     <div class="line">My friends and brethren in these great affairs,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must acquaint you that I have received</div>
                     <div class="line">New-dated letters from Northumberland;</div>
                     <div class="line">Their cold intent, tenor and substance, thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here doth he wish his person, with such powers</div>
                     <div class="line">As might hold sortance with his quality,</div>
                     <div class="line">The which he could not levy; whereupon</div>
                     <div class="line">He is retired, to ripe his growing fortunes,</div>
                     <div class="line">To Scotland: and concludes in hearty prayers</div>
                     <div class="line">That your attempts may overlive the hazard</div>
                     <div class="line">And fearful melting of their opposite.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus do the hopes we have in him touch ground</div>
                     <div class="line">And dash themselves to pieces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">West of this forest, scarcely off a mile,</div>
                     <div class="line">In goodly form comes on the enemy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by the ground they hide, I judge their number</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon or near the rate of thirty thousand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">The just proportion that we gave them out</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us sway on and face them in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">What well-appointed leader fronts us here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it is my Lord of Westmoreland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Health and fair greeting from our general,</div>
                     <div class="line">The prince, Lord John and Duke of Lancaster.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Say on, my Lord of Westmoreland, in peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">What doth concern your coming?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto your grace do I in chief address</div>
                     <div class="line">The substance of my speech. If that rebellion</div>
                     <div class="line">Came like itself, in base and abject routs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Led on by bloody youth, guarded with rags,</div>
                     <div class="line">And countenanced by boys and beggary,</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, if damn'd commotion so appear'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">In his true, native and most proper shape,</div>
                     <div class="line">You, reverend father, and these noble lords</div>
                     <div class="line">Had not been here, to dress the ugly form</div>
                     <div class="line">Of base and bloody insurrection</div>
                     <div class="line">With your fair honours. You, lord archbishop,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose see is by a civil peace maintained,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose beard the silver hand of peace hath touch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose learning and good letters peace hath tutor'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose white investments figure innocence,</div>
                     <div class="line">The dove and very blessed spirit of peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore do you so ill translate ourself</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the speech of peace that bears such grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the harsh and boisterous tongue of war;</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning your books to graves, your ink to blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your pens to lances and your tongue divine</div>
                     <div class="line">To a trumpet and a point of war?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore do I this? so the question stands.</div>
                     <div class="line">Briefly to this end: we are all diseased,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with our surfeiting and wanton hours</div>
                     <div class="line">Have brought ourselves into a burning fever,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we must bleed for it; of which disease</div>
                     <div class="line">Our late king, Richard, being infected, died.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, my most noble Lord of Westmoreland,</div>
                     <div class="line">I take not on me here as a physician,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor do I as an enemy to peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Troop in the throngs of military men;</div>
                     <div class="line">But rather show awhile like fearful war,</div>
                     <div class="line">To diet rank minds sick of happiness</div>
                     <div class="line">And purge the obstructions which begin to stop</div>
                     <div class="line">Our very veins of life. Hear me more plainly.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have in equal balance justly weigh'd</div>
                     <div class="line">What wrongs our arms may do, what wrongs we suffer,</div>
                     <div class="line">And find our griefs heavier than our offences.</div>
                     <div class="line">We see which way the stream of time doth run,</div>
                     <div class="line">And are enforced from our most quiet there</div>
                     <div class="line">By the rough torrent of occasion;</div>
                     <div class="line">And have the summary of all our griefs,</div>
                     <div class="line">When time shall serve, to show in articles;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which long ere this we offer'd to the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And might by no suit gain our audience:</div>
                     <div class="line">When we are wrong'd and would unfold our griefs,</div>
                     <div class="line">We are denied access unto his person</div>
                     <div class="line">Even by those men that most have done us wrong.</div>
                     <div class="line">The dangers of the days but newly gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose memory is written on the earth</div>
                     <div class="line">With yet appearing blood, and the examples</div>
                     <div class="line">Of every minute's instance, present now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath put us in these ill-beseeming arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to break peace or any branch of it,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to establish here a peace indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Concurring both in name and quality.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">When ever yet was your appeal denied?</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein have you been galled by the king?</div>
                     <div class="line">What peer hath been suborn'd to grate on you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you should seal this lawless bloody book</div>
                     <div class="line">Of forged rebellion with a seal divine</div>
                     <div class="line">And consecrate commotion's bitter edge?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother general, the commonwealth,</div>
                     <div class="line">To brother born an household cruelty,</div>
                     <div class="line">I make my quarrel in particular.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no need of any such redress;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if there were, it not belongs to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why not to him in part, and to us all</div>
                     <div class="line">That feel the bruises of the days before,</div>
                     <div class="line">And suffer the condition of these times</div>
                     <div class="line">To lay a heavy and unequal hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon our honours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my good Lord Mowbray,</div>
                     <div class="line">Construe the times to their necessities,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you shall say indeed, it is the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not the king, that doth you injuries.</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet for your part, it not appears to me</div>
                     <div class="line">Either from the king or in the present time</div>
                     <div class="line">That you should have an inch of any ground</div>
                     <div class="line">To build a grief on: were you not restored</div>
                     <div class="line">To all the Duke of Norfolk's signories,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your noble and right well remember'd father's?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">What thing, in honour, had my father lost,</div>
                     <div class="line">That need to be revived and breathed in me?</div>
                     <div class="line">The king that loved him, as the state stood then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was force perforce compell'd to banish him:</div>
                     <div class="line">And then that Harry Bolingbroke and he,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being mounted and both roused in their seats,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their neighing coursers daring of the spur,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their armed staves in charge, their beavers down,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their eyes of fire sparking through sights of steel</div>
                     <div class="line">And the loud trumpet blowing them together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, then, when there was nothing could have stay'd</div>
                     <div class="line">My father from the breast of Bolingbroke,</div>
                     <div class="line">O when the king did throw his warder down,</div>
                     <div class="line">His own life hung upon the staff he threw;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then threw he down himself and all their lives</div>
                     <div class="line">That by indictment and by dint of sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Have since miscarried under Bolingbroke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">You speak, Lord Mowbray, now you know not what.</div>
                     <div class="line">The Earl of Hereford was reputed then</div>
                     <div class="line">In England the most valiant gentlemen:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who knows on whom fortune would then have smiled?</div>
                     <div class="line">But if your father had been victor there,</div>
                     <div class="line">He ne'er had borne it out of Coventry:</div>
                     <div class="line">For all the country in a general voice</div>
                     <div class="line">Cried hate upon him; and all their prayers and love</div>
                     <div class="line">Were set on Hereford, whom they doted on</div>
                     <div class="line">And bless'd and graced indeed, more than the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">But this is mere digression from my purpose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come I from our princely general</div>
                     <div class="line">To know your griefs; to tell you from his grace</div>
                     <div class="line">That he will give you audience; and wherein</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall appear that your demands are just,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall enjoy them, every thing set off</div>
                     <div class="line">That might so much as think you enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">But he hath forced us to compel this offer;</div>
                     <div class="line">And it proceeds from policy, not love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Mowbray, you overween to take it so;</div>
                     <div class="line">This offer comes from mercy, not from fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">For, lo! within a ken our army lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon mine honour, all too confident</div>
                     <div class="line">To give admittance to a thought of fear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Our battle is more full of names than yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our men more perfect in the use of arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our armour all as strong, our cause the best;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then reason will our heart should be as good</div>
                     <div class="line">Say you not then our offer is compell'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, by my will we shall admit no parley.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">That argues but the shame of your offence:</div>
                     <div class="line">A rotten case abides no handling.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath the Prince John a full commission,</div>
                     <div class="line">In very ample virtue of his father,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear and absolutely to determine</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what conditions we shall stand upon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">That is intended in the general's name:</div>
                     <div class="line">I muse you make so slight a question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then take, my Lord of Westmoreland, this schedule,</div>
                     <div class="line">For this contains our general grievances:</div>
                     <div class="line">Each several article herein redress'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">All members of our cause, both here and hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">That are insinew'd to this action,</div>
                     <div class="line">Acquitted by a true substantial form</div>
                     <div class="line">And present execution of our wills</div>
                     <div class="line">To us and to our purposes confined,</div>
                     <div class="line">We come within our awful banks again</div>
                     <div class="line">And knit our powers to the arm of peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">This will I show the general. Please you, lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">In sight of both our battles we may meet;</div>
                     <div class="line">And either end in peace, which God so frame!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to the place of difference call the swords</div>
                     <div class="line">Which must decide it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we will do so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a thing within my bosom tells me</div>
                     <div class="line">That no conditions of our peace can stand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear you not that: if we can make our peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon such large terms and so absolute</div>
                     <div class="line">As our conditions shall consist upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our peace shall stand as firm as rocky mountains.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, but our valuation shall be such</div>
                     <div class="line">That every slight and false-derived cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, every idle, nice and wanton reason</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall to the king taste of this action;</div>
                     <div class="line">That, were our royal faiths martyrs in love,</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall be winnow'd with so rough a wind</div>
                     <div class="line">That even our corn shall seem as light as chaff</div>
                     <div class="line">And good from bad find no partition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, my lord. Note this; the king is weary</div>
                     <div class="line">Of dainty and such picking grievances:</div>
                     <div class="line">For he hath found to end one doubt by death</div>
                     <div class="line">Revives two greater in the heirs of life,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore will he wipe his tables clean</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep no tell-tale to his memory</div>
                     <div class="line">That may repeat and history his loss</div>
                     <div class="line">To new remembrance; for full well he knows</div>
                     <div class="line">He cannot so precisely weed this land</div>
                     <div class="line">As his misdoubts present occasion:</div>
                     <div class="line">His foes are so enrooted with his friends</div>
                     <div class="line">That, plucking to unfix an enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">He doth unfasten so and shake a friend:</div>
                     <div class="line">So that this land, like an offensive wife</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath enraged him on to offer strokes,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he is striking, holds his infant up</div>
                     <div class="line">And hangs resolved correction in the arm</div>
                     <div class="line">That was uprear'd to execution.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, the king hath wasted all his rods</div>
                     <div class="line">On late offenders, that he now doth lack</div>
                     <div class="line">The very instruments of chastisement:</div>
                     <div class="line">So that his power, like to a fangless lion,</div>
                     <div class="line">May offer, but not hold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis very true:</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore be assured, my good lord marshal,</div>
                     <div class="line">If we do now make our atonement well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our peace will, like a broken limb united,</div>
                     <div class="line">Grow stronger for the breaking.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it so.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is return'd my Lord of Westmoreland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter WESTMORELAND</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">The prince is here at hand: pleaseth your lordship</div>
                     <div class="line">To meet his grace just distance 'tween our armies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace of York, in God's name then, set forward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Before, and greet his grace: my lord, we come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Another part of the forest.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, from one side, MOWBRAY, attended; afterwards
the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK, HASTINGS, and others: from
the other side, Prince John of LANCASTER, and
WESTMORELAND; Officers, and others with them</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                     <div class="line">You are well encounter'd here, my cousin Mowbray:</div>
                     <div class="line">Good day to you, gentle lord archbishop;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so to you, Lord Hastings, and to all.</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of York, it better show'd with you</div>
                     <div class="line">When that your flock, assembled by the bell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Encircled you to hear with reverence</div>
                     <div class="line">Your exposition on the holy text</div>
                     <div class="line">Than now to see you here an iron man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cheering a rout of rebels with your drum,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning the word to sword and life to death.</div>
                     <div class="line">That man that sits within a monarch's heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ripens in the sunshine of his favour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would he abuse the countenance of the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, what mischiefs might he set abrooch</div>
                     <div class="line">In shadow of such greatness! With you, lord bishop,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is even so. Who hath not heard it spoken</div>
                     <div class="line">How deep you were within the books of God?</div>
                     <div class="line">To us the speaker in his parliament;</div>
                     <div class="line">To us the imagined voice of God himself;</div>
                     <div class="line">The very opener and intelligencer</div>
                     <div class="line">Between the grace, the sanctities of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">And our dull workings. O, who shall believe</div>
                     <div class="line">But you misuse the reverence of your place,</div>
                     <div class="line">Employ the countenance and grace of heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">As a false favourite doth his prince's name,</div>
                     <div class="line">In deeds dishonourable? You have ta'en up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the counterfeited zeal of God,</div>
                     <div class="line">The subjects of his substitute, my father,</div>
                     <div class="line">And both against the peace of heaven and him</div>
                     <div class="line">Have here up-swarm'd them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my Lord of Lancaster,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not here against your father's peace;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as I told my lord of Westmoreland,</div>
                     <div class="line">The time misorder'd doth, in common sense,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crowd us and crush us to this monstrous form,</div>
                     <div class="line">To hold our safety up. I sent your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">The parcels and particulars of our grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">The which hath been with scorn shoved from the court,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereon this Hydra son of war is born;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose dangerous eyes may well be charm'd asleep</div>
                     <div class="line">With grant of our most just and right desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">And true obedience, of this madness cured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stoop tamely to the foot of majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, we ready are to try our fortunes</div>
                     <div class="line">To the last man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">And though we here fall down,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have supplies to second our attempt:</div>
                     <div class="line">If they miscarry, theirs shall second them;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so success of mischief shall be born</div>
                     <div class="line">And heir from heir shall hold this quarrel up</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles England shall have generation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too shallow, Hastings, much too shallow,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sound the bottom of the after-times.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Pleaseth your grace to answer them directly</div>
                     <div class="line">How far forth you do like their articles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I like them all, and do allow them well,</div>
                     <div class="line">And swear here, by the honour of my blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father's purposes have been mistook,</div>
                     <div class="line">And some about him have too lavishly</div>
                     <div class="line">Wrested his meaning and authority.</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, these griefs shall be with speed redress'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my soul, they shall. If this may please you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Discharge your powers unto their several counties,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we will ours: and here between the armies</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's drink together friendly and embrace,</div>
                     <div class="line">That all their eyes may bear those tokens home</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our restored love and amity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I take your princely word for these redresses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I give it you, and will maintain my word:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereupon I drink unto your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, captain, and deliver to the army</div>
                     <div class="line">This news of peace: let them have pay, and part:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know it will well please them. Hie thee, captain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Officer</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">To you, my noble Lord of Westmoreland.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I pledge your grace; and, if you knew what pains</div>
                     <div class="line">I have bestow'd to breed this present peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would drink freely: but my love to ye</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall show itself more openly hereafter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not doubt you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad of it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Health to my lord and gentle cousin, Mowbray.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOWBRAY</div>
                     <div class="line">You wish me health in very happy season;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am, on the sudden, something ill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARCHBISHOP OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Against ill chances men are ever merry;</div>
                     <div class="line">But heaviness foreruns the good event.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore be merry, coz; since sudden sorrow</div>
