                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">TRAVERS</span>
                              <span class="personname">MORTON</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">retainers of Northumberland.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR JOHN FALSTAFF</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">His Page. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BARDOLPH</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PISTOL</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">POINS</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PETO</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">SHALLOW</span>
                              <span class="personname">SILENCE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">country justices.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DAVY, servant to Shallow.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">MOULDY</span>
                              <span class="personname">SHADOW</span>
                              <span class="personname">WART</span>
                              <span class="personname">FEEBLE</span>
                              <span class="personname">BULLCALF</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">recruits.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">FANG</span>
                              <span class="personname">SNARE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">sheriff's officers.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LADY NORTHUMBERLAND</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LADY PERCY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MISTRESS QUICKLY, hostess of a tavern in Eastcheap.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DOLL TEARSHEET</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords and Attendants; Porter, Drawers, Beadles, Grooms, &c.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Dancer, speaker of the epilogue.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  England.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. INDUCTION</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>Warkworth. Before the castle</p>
                  <p>Enter RUMOUR, painted full of tongues</p>
                  <div class="dialogue">
                     <div class="linegroup">
                        <div class="speaker">RUMOUR</div>
                        <div class="line">Open your ears; for which of you will stop</div>
                        <div class="line">The vent of hearing when loud Rumour speaks?</div>
                        <div class="line">I, from the orient to the drooping west,</div>
                        <div class="line">Making the wind my post-horse, still unfold</div>
                        <div class="line">The acts commenced on this ball of earth:</div>
                        <div class="line">Upon my tongues continual slanders ride,</div>
                        <div class="line">The which in every language I pronounce,</div>
                        <div class="line">Stuffing the ears of men with false reports.</div>
                        <div class="line">I speak of peace, while covert enmity</div>
                        <div class="line">Under the smile of safety wounds the world:</div>
                        <div class="line">And who but Rumour, who but only I,</div>
                        <div class="line">Make fearful musters and prepared defence,</div>
                        <div class="line">Whiles the big year, swoln with some other grief,</div>
                        <div class="line">Is thought with child by the stern tyrant war,</div>
                        <div class="line">And no such matter? Rumour is a pipe</div>
                        <div class="line">Blown by surmises, jealousies, conjectures</div>
                        <div class="line">And of so easy and so plain a stop</div>
                        <div class="line">That the blunt monster with uncounted heads,</div>
                        <div class="line">The still-discordant wavering multitude,</div>
                        <div class="line">Can play upon it. But what need I thus</div>
                        <div class="line">My well-known body to anatomize</div>
                        <div class="line">Among my household? Why is Rumour here?</div>
                        <div class="line">I run before King Harry's victory;</div>
                        <div class="line">Who in a bloody field by Shrewsbury</div>
                        <div class="line">Hath beaten down young Hotspur and his troops,</div>
                        <div class="line">Quenching the flame of bold rebellion</div>
                        <div class="line">Even with the rebel's blood. But what mean I</div>
                        <div class="line">To speak so true at first? my office is</div>
                        <div class="line">To noise abroad that Harry Monmouth fell</div>
                        <div class="line">Under the wrath of noble Hotspur's sword,</div>
                        <div class="line">And that the king before the Douglas' rage</div>
                        <div class="line">Stoop'd his anointed head as low as death.</div>
                        <div class="line">This have I rumour'd through the peasant towns</div>
                        <div class="line">Between that royal field of Shrewsbury</div>
                        <div class="line">And this worm-eaten hold of ragged stone,</div>
                        <div class="line">Where Hotspur's father, old Northumberland,</div>
                        <div class="line">Lies crafty-sick: the posts come tiring on,</div>
                        <div class="line">And not a man of them brings other news</div>
                        <div class="line">Than they have learn'd of me: from Rumour's tongues</div>
                        <div class="line">They bring smooth comforts false, worse than</div>
                        <div class="line">true wrongs.</div>
                     </div>
                  </div>
                  <p>Exit</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  London. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  York. The Archbishop's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LORD BARDOLPH</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Who keeps the gate here, ho?</div>
                              <p>The Porter opens the gate</p>
                              <div class="line">Where is the earl?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                              <div class="line">What shall I say you are?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell thou the earl</div>
                              <div class="line">That the Lord Bardolph doth attend him here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                              <div class="line">His lordship is walk'd forth into the orchard;</div>
                              <div class="line">Please it your honour, knock but at the gate,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he himself wilt answer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter NORTHUMBERLAND</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the earl.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Porter</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">What news, Lord Bardolph? every minute now</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be the father of some stratagem:</div>
                              <div class="line">The times are wild: contention, like a horse</div>
                              <div class="line">Full of high feeding, madly hath broke loose</div>
                              <div class="line">And bears down all before him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Noble earl,</div>
                              <div class="line">I bring you certain news from Shrewsbury.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Good, an God will!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">As good as heart can wish:</div>
                              <div class="line">The king is almost wounded to the death;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the fortune of my lord your son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince Harry slain outright; and both the Blunts</div>
                              <div class="line">Kill'd by the hand of Douglas; young Prince John</div>
                              <div class="line">And Westmoreland and Stafford fled the field;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Harry Monmouth's brawn, the hulk Sir John,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is prisoner to your son: O, such a day,</div>
                              <div class="line">So fought, so follow'd and so fairly won,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came not till now to dignify the times,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since Caesar's fortunes!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">How is this derived?</div>
                              <div class="line">Saw you the field? came you from Shrewsbury?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">I spake with one, my lord, that came from thence,</div>
                              <div class="line">A gentleman well bred and of good name,</div>
                              <div class="line">That freely render'd me these news for true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes my servant Travers, whom I sent</div>
                              <div class="line">On Tuesday last to listen after news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter TRAVERS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I over-rode him on the way;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he is furnish'd with no certainties</div>
                              <div class="line">More than he haply may retail from me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, Travers, what good tidings comes with you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TRAVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, Sir John Umfrevile turn'd me back</div>
                              <div class="line">With joyful tidings; and, being better horsed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out-rode me. After him came spurring hard</div>
                              <div class="line">A gentleman, almost forspent with speed,</div>
                              <div class="line">That stopp'd by me to breathe his bloodied horse.</div>
                              <div class="line">He ask'd the way to Chester; and of him</div>
                              <div class="line">I did demand what news from Shrewsbury:</div>
                              <div class="line">He told me that rebellion had bad luck</div>
                              <div class="line">And that young Harry Percy's spur was cold.</div>
                              <div class="line">With that, he gave his able horse the head,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bending forward struck his armed heels</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the panting sides of his poor jade</div>
                              <div class="line">Up to the rowel-head, and starting so</div>
                              <div class="line">He seem'd in running to devour the way,</div>
                              <div class="line">Staying no longer question.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! Again:</div>
                              <div class="line">Said he young Harry Percy's spur was cold?</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Hotspur Coldspur? that rebellion</div>
                              <div class="line">Had met ill luck?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I'll tell you what;</div>
                              <div class="line">If my young lord your son have not the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon mine honour, for a silken point</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll give my barony: never talk of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should that gentleman that rode by Travers</div>
                              <div class="line">Give then such instances of loss?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, he?</div>
                              <div class="line">He was some hilding fellow that had stolen</div>
                              <div class="line">The horse he rode on, and, upon my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Spoke at a venture. Look, here comes more news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MORTON</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, this man's brow, like to a title-leaf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Foretells the nature of a tragic volume:</div>
                              <div class="line">So looks the strand whereon the imperious flood</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath left a witness'd usurpation.</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Morton, didst thou come from Shrewsbury?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">I ran from Shrewsbury, my noble lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where hateful death put on his ugliest mask</div>
                              <div class="line">To fright our party.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth my son and brother?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou tremblest; and the whiteness in thy cheek</div>
                              <div class="line">Is apter than thy tongue to tell thy errand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Even such a man, so faint, so spiritless,</div>
                              <div class="line">So dull, so dead in look, so woe-begone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Drew Priam's curtain in the dead of night,</div>
                              <div class="line">And would have told him half his Troy was burnt;</div>
                              <div class="line">But Priam found the fire ere he his tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I my Percy's death ere thou report'st it.</div>
                              <div class="line">This thou wouldst say, 'Your son did thus and thus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your brother thus: so fought the noble Douglas:'</div>
                              <div class="line">Stopping my greedy ear with their bold deeds:</div>
                              <div class="line">But in the end, to stop my ear indeed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast a sigh to blow away this praise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ending with 'Brother, son, and all are dead.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">Douglas is living, and your brother, yet;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, for my lord your son--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, he is dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">See what a ready tongue suspicion hath!</div>
                              <div class="line">He that but fears the thing he would not know</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath by instinct knowledge from others' eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">That what he fear'd is chanced. Yet speak, Morton;</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell thou an earl his divination lies,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will take it as a sweet disgrace</div>
                              <div class="line">And make thee rich for doing me such wrong.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">You are too great to be by me gainsaid:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your spirit is too true, your fears too certain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, for all this, say not that Percy's dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">I see a strange confession in thine eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shakest thy head and hold'st it fear or sin</div>
                              <div class="line">To speak a truth. If he be slain, say so;</div>
                              <div class="line">The tongue offends not that reports his death:</div>
                              <div class="line">And he doth sin that doth belie the dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not he which says the dead is not alive.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet the first bringer of unwelcome news</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath but a losing office, and his tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">Sounds ever after as a sullen bell,</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember'd tolling a departing friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot think, my lord, your son is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry I should force you to believe</div>
                              <div class="line">That which I would to God I had not seen;</div>
                              <div class="line">But these mine eyes saw him in bloody state,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rendering faint quittance, wearied and out-breathed,</div>
                              <div class="line">To Harry Monmouth; whose swift wrath beat down</div>
                              <div class="line">The never-daunted Percy to the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">From whence with life he never more sprung up.</div>
                              <div class="line">In few, his death, whose spirit lent a fire</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to the dullest peasant in his camp,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being bruited once, took fire and heat away</div>
                              <div class="line">From the best temper'd courage in his troops;</div>
                              <div class="line">For from his metal was his party steel'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which once in him abated, all the rest</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn'd on themselves, like dull and heavy lead:</div>
                              <div class="line">And as the thing that's heavy in itself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon enforcement flies with greatest speed,</div>
                              <div class="line">So did our men, heavy in Hotspur's loss,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lend to this weight such lightness with their fear</div>
                              <div class="line">That arrows fled not swifter toward their aim</div>
                              <div class="line">Than did our soldiers, aiming at their safety,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly from the field. Then was the noble Worcester</div>
                              <div class="line">Too soon ta'en prisoner; and that furious Scot,</div>
                              <div class="line">The bloody Douglas, whose well-labouring sword</div>
                              <div class="line">Had three times slain the appearance of the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gan vail his stomach and did grace the shame</div>
                              <div class="line">Of those that turn'd their backs, and in his flight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stumbling in fear, was took. The sum of all</div>
                              <div class="line">Is that the king hath won, and hath sent out</div>
                              <div class="line">A speedy power to encounter you, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the conduct of young Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">And Westmoreland. This is the news at full.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">For this I shall have time enough to mourn.</div>
                              <div class="line">In poison there is physic; and these news,</div>
                              <div class="line">Having been well, that would have made me sick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being sick, have in some measure made me well:</div>
                              <div class="line">And as the wretch, whose fever-weaken'd joints,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like strengthless hinges, buckle under life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Impatient of his fit, breaks like a fire</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of his keeper's arms, even so my limbs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Weaken'd with grief, being now enraged with grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are thrice themselves. Hence, therefore, thou nice crutch!</div>
                              <div class="line">A scaly gauntlet now with joints of steel</div>
                              <div class="line">Must glove this hand: and hence, thou sickly quoif!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art a guard too wanton for the head</div>
                              <div class="line">Which princes, flesh'd with conquest, aim to hit.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now bind my brows with iron; and approach</div>
                              <div class="line">The ragged'st hour that time and spite dare bring</div>
                              <div class="line">To frown upon the enraged Northumberland!</div>
                              <div class="line">Let heaven kiss earth! now let not Nature's hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep the wild flood confined! let order die!</div>
                              <div class="line">And let this world no longer be a stage</div>
                              <div class="line">To feed contention in a lingering act;</div>
                              <div class="line">But let one spirit of the first-born Cain</div>
                              <div class="line">Reign in all bosoms, that, each heart being set</div>
                              <div class="line">On bloody courses, the rude scene may end,</div>
                              <div class="line">And darkness be the burier of the dead!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TRAVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">This strained passion doth you wrong, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet earl, divorce not wisdom from your honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">The lives of all your loving complices</div>
                              <div class="line">Lean on your health; the which, if you give o'er</div>
                              <div class="line">To stormy passion, must perforce decay.</div>
                              <div class="line">You cast the event of war, my noble lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">And summ'd the account of chance, before you said</div>
                              <div class="line">'Let us make head.' It was your presurmise,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, in the dole of blows, your son might drop:</div>
                              <div class="line">You knew he walk'd o'er perils, on an edge,</div>
                              <div class="line">More likely to fall in than to get o'er;</div>
                              <div class="line">You were advised his flesh was capable</div>
                              <div class="line">Of wounds and scars and that his forward spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Would lift him where most trade of danger ranged:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet did you say 'Go forth;' and none of this,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though strongly apprehended, could restrain</div>
                              <div class="line">The stiff-borne action: what hath then befallen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or what hath this bold enterprise brought forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">More than that being which was like to be?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORD BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">We all that are engaged to this loss</div>
                              <div class="line">Knew that we ventured on such dangerous seas</div>
                              <div class="line">That if we wrought our life 'twas ten to one;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet we ventured, for the gain proposed</div>
                              <div class="line">Choked the respect of likely peril fear'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">And since we are o'erset, venture again.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, we will all put forth, body and goods.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MORTON</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis more than time: and, my most noble lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">I hear for certain, and do speak the truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">The gentle Archbishop of York is up</div>
                              <div class="line">With well-appointed powers: he is a man</div>
                              <div class="line">Who with a double surety binds his followers.</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord your son had only but the corpse,</div>
                              <div class="line">But shadows and the shows of men, to fight;</div>
                              <div class="line">For that same word, rebellion, did divide</div>
                              <div class="line">The action of their bodies from their souls;</div>
                              <div class="line">And they did fight with queasiness, constrain'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">As men drink potions, that their weapons only</div>
                              <div class="line">Seem'd on our side; but, for their spirits and souls,</div>
                              <div class="line">This word, rebellion, it had froze them up,</div>
                              <div class="line">As fish are in a pond. But now the bishop</div>
                              <div class="line">Turns insurrection to religion:</div>
                              <div class="line">Supposed sincere and holy in his thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">He's followed both with body and with mind;</div>
                              <div class="line">And doth enlarge his rising with the blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Of fair King Richard, scraped from Pomfret stones;</div>
                              <div class="line">Derives from heaven his quarrel and his cause;</div>
                              <div class="line">Tells them he doth bestride a bleeding land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gasping for life under great Bolingbroke;</div>
                              <div class="line">And more and less do flock to follow him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORTHUMBERLAND</div>
                              <div class="line">I knew of this before; but, to speak truth,</div>
                              <div class="line">This present grief had wiped it from my mind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go in with me; and counsel every man</div>
                              <div class="line">The aptest way for safety and revenge:</div>
                              <div class="line">Get posts and letters, and make friends with speed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Never so few, and never yet more need.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  London. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter FALSTAFF, with his Page bearing his sword
and buckler</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, you giant, what says the doctor to my water?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">He said, sir, the water itself was a good healthy</div>
                              <div class="line">water; but, for the party that owed it, he might</div>
                              <div class="line">have more diseases than he knew for.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Men of all sorts take a pride to gird at me: the</div>
                              <div class="line">brain of this foolish-compounded clay, man, is not</div>
                              <div class="line">able to invent anything that tends to laughter, more</div>
                              <div class="line">than I invent or is invented on me: I am not only</div>
                              <div class="line">witty in myself, but the cause that wit is in other</div>
                              <div class="line">men. I do here walk before thee like a sow that</div>
                              <div class="line">hath overwhelmed all her litter but one. If the</div>
                              <div class="line">prince put thee into my service for any other reason</div>
                              <div class="line">than to set me off, why then I have no judgment.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou whoreson mandrake, thou art fitter to be worn</div>
                              <div class="line">in my cap than to wait at my heels. I was never</div>
                              <div class="line">manned with an agate till now: but I will inset you</div>
                              <div class="line">neither in gold nor silver, but in vile apparel, and</div>
                              <div class="line">send you back again to your master, for a jewel,--</div>
                              <div class="line">the juvenal, the prince your master, whose chin is</div>
                              <div class="line">not yet fledged. I will sooner have a beard grow in</div>
                              <div class="line">the palm of my hand than he shall get one on his</div>
                              <div class="line">cheek; and yet he will not stick to say his face is</div>
                              <div class="line">a face-royal: God may finish it when he will, 'tis</div>
                              <div class="line">not a hair amiss yet: he may keep it still at a</div>
                              <div class="line">face-royal, for a barber shall never earn sixpence</div>
                              <div class="line">out of it; and yet he'll be crowing as if he had</div>
                              <div class="line">writ man ever since his father was a bachelor. He</div>
                              <div class="line">may keep his own grace, but he's almost out of mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">I can assure him. What said Master Dombledon about</div>
                              <div class="line">the satin for my short cloak and my slops?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">He said, sir, you should procure him better</div>
                              <div class="line">assurance than Bardolph: he would not take his</div>
                              <div class="line">band and yours; he liked not the security.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him be damned, like the glutton! pray God his</div>
                              <div class="line">tongue be hotter! A whoreson Achitophel! a rascally</div>
                              <div class="line">yea-forsooth knave! to bear a gentleman in hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">and then stand upon security! The whoreson</div>
                              <div class="line">smooth-pates do now wear nothing but high shoes, and</div>
                              <div class="line">bunches of keys at their girdles; and if a man is</div>
                              <div class="line">through with them in honest taking up, then they</div>
                              <div class="line">must stand upon security. I had as lief they would</div>
                              <div class="line">put ratsbane in my mouth as offer to stop it with</div>
                              <div class="line">security. I looked a' should have sent me two and</div>
                              <div class="line">twenty yards of satin, as I am a true knight, and he</div>
                              <div class="line">sends me security. Well, he may sleep in security;</div>
                              <div class="line">for he hath the horn of abundance, and the lightness</div>
                              <div class="line">of his wife shines through it: and yet cannot he</div>
                              <div class="line">see, though he have his own lanthorn to light him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's Bardolph?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">He's gone into Smithfield to buy your worship a horse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I bought him in Paul's, and he'll buy me a horse in</div>
                              <div class="line">Smithfield: an I could get me but a wife in the</div>
                              <div class="line">stews, I were manned, horsed, and wived.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Lord Chief-Justice and Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, here comes the nobleman that committed the</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince for striking him about Bardolph.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Wait, close; I will not see him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">What's he that goes there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Falstaff, an't please your lordship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">He that was in question for the robbery?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">He, my lord: but he hath since done good service at</div>
                              <div class="line">Shrewsbury; and, as I hear, is now going with some</div>
                              <div class="line">charge to the Lord John of Lancaster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">What, to York? Call him back again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John Falstaff!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Boy, tell him I am deaf.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">You must speak louder; my master is deaf.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sure he is, to the hearing of any thing good.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, pluck him by the elbow; I must speak with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">What! a young knave, and begging! Is there not</div>
                              <div class="line">wars? is there not employment? doth not the king</div>
                              <div class="line">lack subjects? do not the rebels need soldiers?</div>
                              <div class="line">Though it be a shame to be on any side but one, it</div>
                              <div class="line">is worse shame to beg than to be on the worst side,</div>
                              <div class="line">were it worse than the name of rebellion can tell</div>
                              <div class="line">how to make it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">You mistake me, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, sir, did I say you were an honest man? setting</div>
                              <div class="line">my knighthood and my soldiership aside, I had lied</div>
                              <div class="line">in my throat, if I had said so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, sir, then set your knighthood and our</div>
                              <div class="line">soldiership aside; and give me leave to tell you,</div>
                              <div class="line">you lie in your throat, if you say I am any other</div>
                              <div class="line">than an honest man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I give thee leave to tell me so! I lay aside that</div>
                              <div class="line">which grows to me! if thou gettest any leave of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">hang me; if thou takest leave, thou wert better be</div>
                              <div class="line">hanged. You hunt counter: hence! avaunt!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, my lord would speak with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John Falstaff, a word with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My good lord! God give your lordship good time of</div>
                              <div class="line">day. I am glad to see your lordship abroad: I heard</div>
                              <div class="line">say your lordship was sick: I hope your lordship</div>
                              <div class="line">goes abroad by advice. Your lordship, though not</div>
                              <div class="line">clean past your youth, hath yet some smack of age in</div>
                              <div class="line">you, some relish of the saltness of time; and I must</div>
                              <div class="line">humbly beseech your lordship to have a reverent care</div>
                              <div class="line">of your health.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John, I sent for you before your expedition to</div>
                              <div class="line">Shrewsbury.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">An't please your lordship, I hear his majesty is</div>
                              <div class="line">returned with some discomfort from Wales.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I talk not of his majesty: you would not come when</div>
                              <div class="line">I sent for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">And I hear, moreover, his highness is fallen into</div>
                              <div class="line">this same whoreson apoplexy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, God mend him! I pray you, let me speak with</div>
                              <div class="line">you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">This apoplexy is, as I take it, a kind of lethargy,</div>
                              <div class="line">an't please your lordship; a kind of sleeping in the</div>
                              <div class="line">blood, a whoreson tingling.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">What tell you me of it? be it as it is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath its original from much grief, from study and</div>
                              <div class="line">perturbation of the brain: I have read the cause of</div>
                              <div class="line">his effects in Galen: it is a kind of deafness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I think you are fallen into the disease; for you</div>
                              <div class="line">hear not what I say to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Very well, my lord, very well: rather, an't please</div>
                              <div class="line">you, it is the disease of not listening, the malady</div>
                              <div class="line">of not marking, that I am troubled withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">To punish you by the heels would amend the</div>
                              <div class="line">attention of your ears; and I care not if I do</div>
                              <div class="line">become your physician.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I am as poor as Job, my lord, but not so patient:</div>
                              <div class="line">your lordship may minister the potion of</div>
                              <div class="line">imprisonment to me in respect of poverty; but how</div>
                              <div class="line">should I be your patient to follow your</div>
                              <div class="line">prescriptions, the wise may make some dram of a</div>
                              <div class="line">scruple, or indeed a scruple itself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I sent for you, when there were matters against you</div>
                              <div class="line">for your life, to come speak with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">As I was then advised by my learned counsel in the</div>
                              <div class="line">laws of this land-service, I did not come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, the truth is, Sir John, you live in great infamy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">He that buckles him in my belt cannot live in less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Your means are very slender, and your waste is great.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I would it were otherwise; I would my means were</div>
                              <div class="line">greater, and my waist slenderer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">You have misled the youthful prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">The young prince hath misled me: I am the fellow</div>
                              <div class="line">with the great belly, and he my dog.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, I am loath to gall a new-healed wound: your</div>
                              <div class="line">day's service at Shrewsbury hath a little gilded</div>
                              <div class="line">over your night's exploit on Gad's-hill: you may</div>
                              <div class="line">thank the unquiet time for your quiet o'er-posting</div>
                              <div class="line">that action.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">But since all is well, keep it so: wake not a</div>
                              <div class="line">sleeping wolf.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">To wake a wolf is as bad as to smell a fox.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">What! you are as a candle, the better part burnt</div>
                              <div class="line">out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">A wassail candle, my lord, all tallow: if I did say</div>
                              <div class="line">of wax, my growth would approve the truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">There is not a white hair on your face but should</div>
                              <div class="line">have his effect of gravity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">His effect of gravy, gravy, gravy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">You follow the young prince up and down, like his</div>
                              <div class="line">ill angel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so, my lord; your ill angel is light; but I hope</div>
                              <div class="line">he that looks upon me will take me without weighing:</div>
                              <div class="line">and yet, in some respects, I grant, I cannot go: I</div>
                              <div class="line">cannot tell. Virtue is of so little regard in these</div>
                              <div class="line">costermonger times that true valour is turned</div>
                              <div class="line">bear-herd: pregnancy is made a tapster, and hath</div>
                              <div class="line">his quick wit wasted in giving reckonings: all the</div>
                              <div class="line">other gifts appertinent to man, as the malice of</div>
                              <div class="line">this age shapes them, are not worth a gooseberry.</div>
                              <div class="line">You that are old consider not the capacities of us</div>
                              <div class="line">that are young; you do measure the heat of our</div>
                              <div class="line">livers with the bitterness of your galls: and we</div>
                              <div class="line">that are in the vaward of our youth, I must confess,</div>
                              <div class="line">are wags too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you set down your name in the scroll of youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">that are written down old with all the characters of</div>
                              <div class="line">age? Have you not a moist eye? a dry hand? a</div>
                              <div class="line">yellow cheek? a white beard? a decreasing leg? an</div>
                              <div class="line">increasing belly? is not your voice broken? your</div>
                              <div class="line">wind short? your chin double? your wit single? and</div>
                              <div class="line">every part about you blasted with antiquity? and</div>
                              <div class="line">will you yet call yourself young? Fie, fie, fie, Sir John!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I was born about three of the clock in the</div>
                              <div class="line">afternoon, with a white head and something a round</div>
                              <div class="line">belly. For my voice, I have lost it with halloing</div>
                              <div class="line">and singing of anthems. To approve my youth</div>
                              <div class="line">further, I will not: the truth is, I am only old in</div>
                              <div class="line">judgment and understanding; and he that will caper</div>
                              <div class="line">with me for a thousand marks, let him lend me the</div>
                              <div class="line">money, and have at him! For the box of the ear that</div>
                              <div class="line">the prince gave you, he gave it like a rude prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">and you took it like a sensible lord. I have</div>
                              <div class="line">chequed him for it, and the young lion repents;</div>
                              <div class="line">marry, not in ashes and sackcloth, but in new silk</div>
                              <div class="line">and old sack.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, God send the prince a better companion!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">God send the companion a better prince! I cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">rid my hands of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, the king hath severed you and Prince Harry: I</div>
                              <div class="line">hear you are going with Lord John of Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">against the Archbishop and the Earl of</div>
                              <div class="line">Northumberland.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea; I thank your pretty sweet wit for it. But look</div>
                              <div class="line">you pray, all you that kiss my lady Peace at home,</div>
                              <div class="line">that our armies join not in a hot day; for, by the</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord, I take but two shirts out with me, and I mean</div>
                              <div class="line">not to sweat extraordinarily: if it be a hot day,</div>
                              <div class="line">and I brandish any thing but a bottle, I would I</div>
                              <div class="line">might never spit white again. There is not a</div>
                              <div class="line">dangerous action can peep out his head but I am</div>
                              <div class="line">thrust upon it: well, I cannot last ever: but it</div>
                              <div class="line">was alway yet the trick of our English nation, if</div>
                              <div class="line">they have a good thing, to make it too common. If</div>
                              <div class="line">ye will needs say I am an old man, you should give</div>
                              <div class="line">me rest. I would to God my name were not so</div>
                              <div class="line">terrible to the enemy as it is: I were better to be</div>
                              <div class="line">eaten to death with a rust than to be scoured to</div>
                              <div class="line">nothing with perpetual motion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, be honest, be honest; and God bless your</div>
                              <div class="line">expedition!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Will your lordship lend me a thousand pound to</div>
                              <div class="line">furnish me forth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a penny, not a penny; you are too impatient to</div>
                              <div class="line">bear crosses. Fare you well: commend me to my</div>
                              <div class="line">cousin Westmoreland.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Chief-Justice and Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">If I do, fillip me with a three-man beetle. A man</div>
                              <div class="line">can no more separate age and covetousness than a'</div>
                              <div class="line">can part young limbs and lechery: but the gout</div>
                              <div class="line">galls the one, and the pox pinches the other; and</div>
                              <div class="line">so both the degrees prevent my curses. Boy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">What money is in my purse?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">Seven groats and two pence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I can get no remedy against this consumption of the</div>
                              <div class="line">purse: borrowing only lingers and lingers it out,</div>
                              <div class="line">but the disease is incurable. Go bear this letter</div>
                              <div class="line">to my Lord of Lancaster; this to the prince; this</div>
                              <div class="line">to the Earl of Westmoreland; and this to old</div>
