                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What would my lord and father?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing but well to thee, Thomas of Clarence.</div>
                              <div class="line">How chance thou art not with the prince thy brother?</div>
                              <div class="line">He loves thee, and thou dost neglect him, Thomas;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast a better place in his affection</div>
                              <div class="line">Than all thy brothers: cherish it, my boy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And noble offices thou mayst effect</div>
                              <div class="line">Of mediation, after I am dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Between his greatness and thy other brethren:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore omit him not; blunt not his love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor lose the good advantage of his grace</div>
                              <div class="line">By seeming cold or careless of his will;</div>
                              <div class="line">For he is gracious, if he be observed:</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath a tear for pity and a hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Open as day for melting charity:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet notwithstanding, being incensed, he's flint,</div>
                              <div class="line">As humorous as winter and as sudden</div>
                              <div class="line">As flaws congealed in the spring of day.</div>
                              <div class="line">His temper, therefore, must be well observed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Chide him for faults, and do it reverently,</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou perceive his blood inclined to mirth;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, being moody, give him line and scope,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till that his passions, like a whale on ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">Confound themselves with working. Learn this, Thomas,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt prove a shelter to thy friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">A hoop of gold to bind thy brothers in,</div>
                              <div class="line">That the united vessel of their blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mingled with venom of suggestion--</div>
                              <div class="line">As, force perforce, the age will pour it in--</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall never leak, though it do work as strong</div>
                              <div class="line">As aconitum or rash gunpowder.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall observe him with all care and love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why art thou not at Windsor with him, Thomas?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not there to-day; he dines in London.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">And how accompanied? canst thou tell that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">With Poins, and other his continual followers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Most subject is the fattest soil to weeds;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he, the noble image of my youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is overspread with them: therefore my grief</div>
                              <div class="line">Stretches itself beyond the hour of death:</div>
                              <div class="line">The blood weeps from my heart when I do shape</div>
                              <div class="line">In forms imaginary the unguided days</div>
                              <div class="line">And rotten times that you shall look upon</div>
                              <div class="line">When I am sleeping with my ancestors.</div>
                              <div class="line">For when his headstrong riot hath no curb,</div>
                              <div class="line">When rage and hot blood are his counsellors,</div>
                              <div class="line">When means and lavish manners meet together,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, with what wings shall his affections fly</div>
                              <div class="line">Towards fronting peril and opposed decay!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious lord, you look beyond him quite:</div>
                              <div class="line">The prince but studies his companions</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a strange tongue, wherein, to gain the language,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis needful that the most immodest word</div>
                              <div class="line">Be look'd upon and learn'd; which once attain'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your highness knows, comes to no further use</div>
                              <div class="line">But to be known and hated. So, like gross terms,</div>
                              <div class="line">The prince will in the perfectness of time</div>
                              <div class="line">Cast off his followers; and their memory</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall as a pattern or a measure live,</div>
                              <div class="line">By which his grace must mete the lives of others,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turning past evils to advantages.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis seldom when the bee doth leave her comb</div>
                              <div class="line">In the dead carrion.</div>
                              <p>Enter WESTMORELAND</p>
                              <div class="line">Who's here? Westmoreland?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Health to my sovereign, and new happiness</div>
                              <div class="line">Added to that that I am to deliver!</div>
                              <div class="line">Prince John your son doth kiss your grace's hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">Mowbray, the Bishop Scroop, Hastings and all</div>
                              <div class="line">Are brought to the correction of your law;</div>
                              <div class="line">There is not now a rebel's sword unsheath'd</div>
                              <div class="line">But peace puts forth her olive every where.</div>
                              <div class="line">The manner how this action hath been borne</div>
                              <div class="line">Here at more leisure may your highness read,</div>
                              <div class="line">With every course in his particular.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">O Westmoreland, thou art a summer bird,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which ever in the haunch of winter sings</div>
                              <div class="line">The lifting up of day.</div>
                              <p>Enter HARCOURT</p>
                              <div class="line">Look, here's more news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HARCOURT</div>
                              <div class="line">From enemies heaven keep your majesty;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, when they stand against you, may they fall</div>
                              <div class="line">As those that I am come to tell you of!</div>
                              <div class="line">The Earl Northumberland and the Lord Bardolph,</div>
                              <div class="line">With a great power of English and of Scots</div>
                              <div class="line">Are by the sheriff of Yorkshire overthrown:</div>
                              <div class="line">The manner and true order of the fight</div>
                              <div class="line">This packet, please it you, contains at large.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">And wherefore should these good news make me sick?</div>
                              <div class="line">Will fortune never come with both hands full,</div>
                              <div class="line">But write her fair words still in foulest letters?</div>
                              <div class="line">She either gives a stomach and no food;</div>
                              <div class="line">Such are the poor, in health; or else a feast</div>
                              <div class="line">And takes away the stomach; such are the rich,</div>
                              <div class="line">That have abundance and enjoy it not.</div>
                              <div class="line">I should rejoice now at this happy news;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now my sight fails, and my brain is giddy:</div>
                              <div class="line">O me! come near me; now I am much ill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Comfort, your majesty!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O my royal father!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WESTMORELAND</div>
                              <div class="line">My sovereign lord, cheer up yourself, look up.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient, princes; you do know, these fits</div>
                              <div class="line">Are with his highness very ordinary.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand from him. Give him air; he'll straight be well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no, he cannot long hold out these pangs:</div>
                              <div class="line">The incessant care and labour of his mind</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath wrought the mure that should confine it in</div>
                              <div class="line">So thin that life looks through and will break out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The people fear me; for they do observe</div>
                              <div class="line">Unfather'd heirs and loathly births of nature:</div>
                              <div class="line">The seasons change their manners, as the year</div>
                              <div class="line">Had found some months asleep and leap'd them over.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">The river hath thrice flow'd, no ebb between;</div>
                              <div class="line">And the old folk, time's doting chronicles,</div>
                              <div class="line">Say it did so a little time before</div>
                              <div class="line">That our great-grandsire, Edward, sick'd and died.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak lower, princes, for the king recovers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">This apoplexy will certain be his end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, take me up, and bear me hence</div>
                              <div class="line">Into some other chamber: softly, pray.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another chamber.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>KING HENRY IV lying on a bed: CLARENCE,
GLOUCESTER, WARWICK, and others in attendance</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Let there be no noise made, my gentle friends;</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless some dull and favourable hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Will whisper music to my weary spirit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Call for the music in the other room.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Set me the crown upon my pillow here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">His eye is hollow, and he changes much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Less noise, less noise!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PRINCE HENRY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Who saw the Duke of Clarence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am here, brother, full of heaviness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! rain within doors, and none abroad!</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth the king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceeding ill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">Heard he the good news yet?</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell it him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He alter'd much upon the hearing it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">If he be sick with joy, he'll recover without physic.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so much noise, my lords: sweet prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">speak low;</div>
                              <div class="line">The king your father is disposed to sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us withdraw into the other room.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Will't please your grace to go along with us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">No; I will sit and watch here by the king.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all but PRINCE HENRY</p>
                              <div class="line">Why doth the crown lie there upon his pillow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being so troublesome a bedfellow?</div>
                              <div class="line">O polish'd perturbation! golden care!</div>
                              <div class="line">That keep'st the ports of slumber open wide</div>
                              <div class="line">To many a watchful night! sleep with it now!</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet not so sound and half so deeply sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">As he whose brow with homely biggen bound</div>
                              <div class="line">Snores out the watch of night. O majesty!</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou dost pinch thy bearer, thou dost sit</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a rich armour worn in heat of day,</div>
                              <div class="line">That scalds with safety. By his gates of breath</div>
                              <div class="line">There lies a downy feather which stirs not:</div>
                              <div class="line">Did he suspire, that light and weightless down</div>
                              <div class="line">Perforce must move. My gracious lord! my father!</div>
                              <div class="line">This sleep is sound indeed, this is a sleep</div>
                              <div class="line">That from this golden rigol hath divorced</div>
                              <div class="line">So many English kings. Thy due from me</div>
                              <div class="line">Is tears and heavy sorrows of the blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which nature, love, and filial tenderness,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall, O dear father, pay thee plenteously:</div>
                              <div class="line">My due from thee is this imperial crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, as immediate as thy place and blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Derives itself to me. Lo, here it sits,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which God shall guard: and put the world's whole strength</div>
                              <div class="line">Into one giant arm, it shall not force</div>
                              <div class="line">This lineal honour from me: this from thee</div>
                              <div class="line">Will I to mine leave, as 'tis left to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Warwick! Gloucester! Clarence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter WARWICK, GLOUCESTER, CLARENCE, and the rest</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth the king call?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">What would your majesty? How fares your grace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why did you leave me here alone, my lords?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">We left the prince my brother here, my liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who undertook to sit and watch by you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">The Prince of Wales! Where is he? let me see him:</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">This door is open; he is gone this way.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He came not through the chamber where we stay'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the crown? who took it from my pillow?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">When we withdrew, my liege, we left it here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">The prince hath ta'en it hence: go, seek him out.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is he so hasty that he doth suppose</div>
                              <div class="line">My sleep my death?</div>
                              <div class="line">Find him, my Lord of Warwick; chide him hither.</div>
                              <p>Exit WARWICK</p>
                              <div class="line">This part of his conjoins with my disease,</div>
                              <div class="line">And helps to end me. See, sons, what things you are!</div>
                              <div class="line">How quickly nature falls into revolt</div>
                              <div class="line">When gold becomes her object!</div>
                              <div class="line">For this the foolish over-careful fathers</div>
                              <div class="line">Have broke their sleep with thoughts, their brains with care,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their bones with industry;</div>
                              <div class="line">For this they have engrossed and piled up</div>
                              <div class="line">The canker'd heaps of strange-achieved gold;</div>
                              <div class="line">For this they have been thoughtful to invest</div>
                              <div class="line">Their sons with arts and martial exercises:</div>
                              <div class="line">When, like the bee, culling from every flower</div>
                              <div class="line">The virtuous sweets,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our thighs pack'd with wax, our mouths with honey,</div>
                              <div class="line">We bring it to the hive, and, like the bees,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are murdered for our pains. This bitter taste</div>
                              <div class="line">Yield his engrossments to the ending father.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter WARWICK</p>
                              <div class="line">Now, where is he that will not stay so long</div>
                              <div class="line">Till his friend sickness hath determined me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, I found the prince in the next room,</div>
                              <div class="line">Washing with kindly tears his gentle cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">With such a deep demeanor in great sorrow</div>
                              <div class="line">That tyranny, which never quaff'd but blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would, by beholding him, have wash'd his knife</div>
                              <div class="line">With gentle eye-drops. He is coming hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">But wherefore did he take away the crown?</div>
                              <p>Re-enter PRINCE HENRY</p>
                              <div class="line">Lo, where he comes. Come hither to me, Harry.</div>
                              <div class="line">Depart the chamber, leave us here alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt WARWICK and the rest</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">I never thought to hear you speak again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy wish was father, Harry, to that thought:</div>
                              <div class="line">I stay too long by thee, I weary thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou so hunger for mine empty chair</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou wilt needs invest thee with my honours</div>
                              <div class="line">Before thy hour be ripe? O foolish youth!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou seek'st the greatness that will o'erwhelm thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay but a little; for my cloud of dignity</div>
                              <div class="line">Is held from falling with so weak a wind</div>
                              <div class="line">That it will quickly drop: my day is dim.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast stolen that which after some few hours</div>
                              <div class="line">Were thine without offence; and at my death</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hast seal'd up my expectation:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy life did manifest thou lovedst me not,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou wilt have me die assured of it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hidest a thousand daggers in thy thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou hast whetted on thy stony heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">To stab at half an hour of my life.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! canst thou not forbear me half an hour?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then get thee gone and dig my grave thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bid the merry bells ring to thine ear</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou art crowned, not that I am dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let all the tears that should bedew my hearse</div>
                              <div class="line">Be drops of balm to sanctify thy head:</div>
                              <div class="line">Only compound me with forgotten dust</div>
                              <div class="line">Give that which gave thee life unto the worms.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pluck down my officers, break my decrees;</div>
                              <div class="line">For now a time is come to mock at form:</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry the Fifth is crown'd: up, vanity!</div>
                              <div class="line">Down, royal state! all you sage counsellors, hence!</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the English court assemble now,</div>
                              <div class="line">From every region, apes of idleness!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, neighbour confines, purge you of your scum:</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you a ruffian that will swear, drink, dance,</div>
                              <div class="line">Revel the night, rob, murder, and commit</div>
                              <div class="line">The oldest sins the newest kind of ways?</div>
                              <div class="line">Be happy, he will trouble you no more;</div>
                              <div class="line">England shall double gild his treble guilt,</div>
                              <div class="line">England shall give him office, honour, might;</div>
                              <div class="line">For the fifth Harry from curb'd licence plucks</div>
                              <div class="line">The muzzle of restraint, and the wild dog</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall flesh his tooth on every innocent.</div>
                              <div class="line">O my poor kingdom, sick with civil blows!</div>
                              <div class="line">When that my care could not withhold thy riots,</div>
                              <div class="line">What wilt thou do when riot is thy care?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, thou wilt be a wilderness again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Peopled with wolves, thy old inhabitants!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">O, pardon me, my liege! but for my tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">The moist impediments unto my speech,</div>
                              <div class="line">I had forestall'd this dear and deep rebuke</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere you with grief had spoke and I had heard</div>
                              <div class="line">The course of it so far. There is your crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">And He that wears the crown immortally</div>
                              <div class="line">Long guard it yours! If I affect it more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than as your honour and as your renown,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me no more from this obedience rise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which my most inward true and duteous spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Teacheth, this prostrate and exterior bending.</div>
                              <div class="line">God witness with me, when I here came in,</div>
                              <div class="line">And found no course of breath within your majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">How cold it struck my heart! If I do feign,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let me in my present wildness die</div>
                              <div class="line">And never live to show the incredulous world</div>
                              <div class="line">The noble change that I have purposed!</div>
                              <div class="line">Coming to look on you, thinking you dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">And dead almost, my liege, to think you were,</div>
                              <div class="line">I spake unto this crown as having sense,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus upbraided it: 'The care on thee depending</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath fed upon the body of my father;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, thou best of gold art worst of gold:</div>
                              <div class="line">Other, less fine in carat, is more precious,</div>
                              <div class="line">Preserving life in medicine potable;</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou, most fine, most honour'd: most renown'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast eat thy bearer up.' Thus, my most royal liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">Accusing it, I put it on my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">To try with it, as with an enemy</div>
                              <div class="line">That had before my face murder'd my father,</div>
                              <div class="line">The quarrel of a true inheritor.</div>
                              <div class="line">But if it did infect my blood with joy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or swell my thoughts to any strain of pride;</div>
                              <div class="line">If any rebel or vain spirit of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Did with the least affection of a welcome</div>
                              <div class="line">Give entertainment to the might of it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let God for ever keep it from my head</div>
                              <div class="line">And make me as the poorest vassal is</div>
                              <div class="line">That doth with awe and terror kneel to it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">O my son,</div>
                              <div class="line">God put it in thy mind to take it hence,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou mightst win the more thy father's love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pleading so wisely in excuse of it!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, Harry, sit thou by my bed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And hear, I think, the very latest counsel</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever I shall breathe. God knows, my son,</div>
                              <div class="line">By what by-paths and indirect crook'd ways</div>
                              <div class="line">I met this crown; and I myself know well</div>
                              <div class="line">How troublesome it sat upon my head.</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee it shall descend with bitter quiet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Better opinion, better confirmation;</div>
                              <div class="line">For all the soil of the achievement goes</div>
                              <div class="line">With me into the earth. It seem'd in me</div>
                              <div class="line">But as an honour snatch'd with boisterous hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I had many living to upbraid</div>
                              <div class="line">My gain of it by their assistances;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which daily grew to quarrel and to bloodshed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wounding supposed peace: all these bold fears</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou see'st with peril I have answered;</div>
                              <div class="line">For all my reign hath been but as a scene</div>
                              <div class="line">Acting that argument: and now my death</div>
                              <div class="line">Changes the mode; for what in me was purchased,</div>
                              <div class="line">Falls upon thee in a more fairer sort;</div>
                              <div class="line">So thou the garland wear'st successively.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, though thou stand'st more sure than I could do,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art not firm enough, since griefs are green;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all my friends, which thou must make thy friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have but their stings and teeth newly ta'en out;</div>
                              <div class="line">By whose fell working I was first advanced</div>
                              <div class="line">And by whose power I well might lodge a fear</div>
                              <div class="line">To be again displaced: which to avoid,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cut them off; and had a purpose now</div>
                              <div class="line">To lead out many to the Holy Land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest rest and lying still might make them look</div>
                              <div class="line">Too near unto my state. Therefore, my Harry,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it thy course to busy giddy minds</div>
                              <div class="line">With foreign quarrels; that action, hence borne out,</div>
                              <div class="line">May waste the memory of the former days.</div>
                              <div class="line">More would I, but my lungs are wasted so</div>
                              <div class="line">That strength of speech is utterly denied me.</div>
                              <div class="line">How I came by the crown, O God forgive;</div>
                              <div class="line">And grant it may with thee in true peace live!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">My gracious liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">You won it, wore it, kept it, gave it me;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then plain and right must my possession be:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I with more than with a common pain</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gainst all the world will rightfully maintain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Lord John of LANCASTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, look, here comes my John of Lancaster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Health, peace, and happiness to my royal father!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou bring'st me happiness and peace, son John;</div>
                              <div class="line">But health, alack, with youthful wings is flown</div>
                              <div class="line">From this bare wither'd trunk: upon thy sight</div>
                              <div class="line">My worldly business makes a period.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is my Lord of Warwick?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE HENRY</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Warwick!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter WARWICK, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth any name particular belong</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the lodging where I first did swoon?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis call'd Jerusalem, my noble lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Laud be to God! even there my life must end.</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath been prophesied to me many years,</div>
                              <div class="line">I should not die but in Jerusalem;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which vainly I supposed the Holy Land:</div>
                              <div class="line">But bear me to that chamber; there I'll lie;</div>
                              <div class="line">In that Jerusalem shall Harry die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.8">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 6. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.2">1. SCENE I.  Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.3">2. SCENE II.  Westminster. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.4">3. SCENE III.  Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.6">5. SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.7">6. EPILOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SHALLOW, FALSTAFF, BARDOLPH, and Page</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">By cock and pie, sir, you shall not away to-night.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, Davy, I say!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">You must excuse me, Master Robert Shallow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not excuse you; you shall not be excused;</div>
                              <div class="line">excuses shall not be admitted; there is no excuse</div>
                              <div class="line">shall serve; you shall not be excused. Why, Davy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DAVY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Davy, Davy, Davy, Davy, let me see, Davy; let me</div>
                              <div class="line">see, Davy; let me see: yea, marry, William cook,</div>
                              <div class="line">bid him come hither. Sir John, you shall not be excused.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, sir, thus; those precepts cannot be served:</div>
                              <div class="line">and, again, sir, shall we sow the headland with wheat?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">With red wheat, Davy. But for William cook: are</div>
                              <div class="line">there no young pigeons?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, sir. Here is now the smith's note for shoeing</div>
                              <div class="line">and plough-irons.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it be cast and paid. Sir John, you shall not be excused.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, sir, a new link to the bucket must need be</div>
                              <div class="line">had: and, sir, do you mean to stop any of William's</div>
                              <div class="line">wages, about the sack he lost the other day at</div>
                              <div class="line">Hinckley fair?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">A' shall answer it. Some pigeons, Davy, a couple</div>
                              <div class="line">of short-legged hens, a joint of mutton, and any</div>
                              <div class="line">pretty little tiny kickshaws, tell William cook.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth the man of war stay all night, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, Davy. I will use him well: a friend i' the</div>
                              <div class="line">court is better than a penny in purse. Use his men</div>
                              <div class="line">well, Davy; for they are arrant knaves, and will backbite.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">No worse than they are backbitten, sir; for they</div>
                              <div class="line">have marvellous foul linen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Well conceited, Davy: about thy business, Davy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">I beseech you, sir, to countenance William Visor of</div>
                              <div class="line">Woncot against Clement Perkes of the hill.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">There is many complaints, Davy, against that Visor:</div>
                              <div class="line">that Visor is an arrant knave, on my knowledge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">I grant your worship that he is a knave, sir; but</div>
                              <div class="line">yet, God forbid, sir, but a knave should have some</div>
                              <div class="line">countenance at his friend's request. An honest</div>
                              <div class="line">man, sir, is able to speak for himself, when a knave</div>
                              <div class="line">is not. I have served your worship truly, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">this eight years; and if I cannot once or twice in</div>
                              <div class="line">a quarter bear out a knave against an honest man, I</div>
                              <div class="line">have but a very little credit with your worship. The</div>
                              <div class="line">knave is mine honest friend, sir; therefore, I</div>
                              <div class="line">beseech your worship, let him be countenanced.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to; I say he shall have no wrong. Look about, Davy.</div>
                              <p>Exit DAVY</p>
                              <div class="line">Where are you, Sir John? Come, come, come, off</div>
                              <div class="line">with your boots. Give me your hand, Master Bardolph.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">I am glad to see your worship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee with all my heart, kind</div>
                              <div class="line">Master Bardolph: and welcome, my tall fellow.</div>
                              <p>To the Page</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, Sir John.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll follow you, good Master Robert Shallow.</div>
                              <p>Exit SHALLOW</p>
                              <div class="line">Bardolph, look to our horses.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt BARDOLPH and Page</p>
                              <div class="line">If I were sawed into quantities, I should make four</div>
                              <div class="line">dozen of such bearded hermits' staves as Master</div>
                              <div class="line">Shallow. It is a wonderful thing to see the</div>
                              <div class="line">semblable coherence of his men's spirits and his:</div>
                              <div class="line">they, by observing of him, do bear themselves like</div>
                              <div class="line">foolish justices; he, by conversing with them, is</div>
                              <div class="line">turned into a justice-like serving-man: their</div>
                              <div class="line">spirits are so married in conjunction with the</div>
                              <div class="line">participation of society that they flock together in</div>
                              <div class="line">consent, like so many wild-geese. If I had a suit</div>
                              <div class="line">to Master Shallow, I would humour his men with the</div>
                              <div class="line">imputation of being near their master: if to his</div>
                              <div class="line">men, I would curry with Master Shallow that no man</div>
                              <div class="line">could better command his servants. It is certain</div>
                              <div class="line">that either wise bearing or ignorant carriage is</div>
                              <div class="line">caught, as men take diseases, one of another:</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore let men take heed of their company. I</div>
                              <div class="line">will devise matter enough out of this Shallow to</div>
                              <div class="line">keep Prince Harry in continual laughter the wearing</div>
                              <div class="line">out of six fashions, which is four terms, or two</div>
                              <div class="line">actions, and a' shall laugh without intervallums. O,</div>
                              <div class="line">it is much that a lie with a slight oath and a jest</div>
                              <div class="line">with a sad brow will do with a fellow that never</div>
                              <div class="line">had the ache in his shoulders! O, you shall see him</div>
                              <div class="line">laugh till his face be like a wet cloak ill laid up!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>  Sir John!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I come, Master Shallow; I come, Master Shallow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Westminster. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter WARWICK and the Lord Chief-Justice, meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my lord chief-justice! whither away?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth the king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceeding well; his cares are now all ended.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope, not dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">He's walk'd the way of nature;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to our purposes he lives no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I would his majesty had call'd me with him:</div>
                              <div class="line">The service that I truly did his life</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath left me open to all injuries.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed I think the young king loves you not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I know he doth not, and do arm myself</div>
                              <div class="line">To welcome the condition of the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which cannot look more hideously upon me</div>
                              <div class="line">Than I have drawn it in my fantasy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter LANCASTER, CLARENCE, GLOUCESTER,
WESTMORELAND, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Here come the heavy issue of dead Harry:</div>
                              <div class="line">O that the living Harry had the temper</div>
                              <div class="line">Of him, the worst of these three gentlemen!</div>
                              <div class="line">How many nobles then should hold their places</div>
                              <div class="line">That must strike sail to spirits of vile sort!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, I fear all will be overturn'd!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, cousin Warwick, good morrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, cousin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">We meet like men that had forgot to speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">We do remember; but our argument</div>
                              <div class="line">Is all too heavy to admit much talk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, peace be with him that hath made us heavy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace be with us, lest we be heavier!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">O, good my lord, you have lost a friend indeed;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I dare swear you borrow not that face</div>
                              <div class="line">Of seeming sorrow, it is sure your own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Though no man be assured what grace to find,</div>
                              <div class="line">You stand in coldest expectation:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am the sorrier; would 'twere otherwise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, you must now speak Sir John Falstaff fair;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which swims against your stream of quality.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet princes, what I did, I did in honour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Led by the impartial conduct of my soul:</div>
                              <div class="line">And never shall you see that I will beg</div>
                              <div class="line">A ragged and forestall'd remission.</div>
                              <div class="line">If truth and upright innocency fail me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to the king my master that is dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell him who hath sent me after him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">WARWICK</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY V, attended</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow; and God save your majesty!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY V</div>
                              <div class="line">This new and gorgeous garment, majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sits not so easy on me as you think.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brothers, you mix your sadness with some fear:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the English, not the Turkish court;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not Amurath an Amurath succeeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">But Harry Harry. Yet be sad, good brothers,</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by my faith, it very well becomes you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sorrow so royally in you appears</div>
                              <div class="line">That I will deeply put the fashion on</div>
                              <div class="line">And wear it in my heart: why then, be sad;</div>
                              <div class="line">But entertain no more of it, good brothers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than a joint burden laid upon us all.</div>
                              <div class="line">For me, by heaven, I bid you be assured,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll be your father and your brother too;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me but bear your love, I 'll bear your cares:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet weep that Harry's dead; and so will I;</div>
                              <div class="line">But Harry lives, that shall convert those tears</div>
                              <div class="line">By number into hours of happiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Princes</div>
                              <div class="line">We hope no other from your majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY V</div>
                              <div class="line">You all look strangely on me: and you most;</div>
                              <div class="line">You are, I think, assured I love you not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I am assured, if I be measured rightly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your majesty hath no just cause to hate me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
