                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY V</div>
                              <div class="line">No!</div>
                              <div class="line">How might a prince of my great hopes forget</div>
                              <div class="line">So great indignities you laid upon me?</div>
                              <div class="line">What! rate, rebuke, and roughly send to prison</div>
                              <div class="line">The immediate heir of England! Was this easy?</div>
                              <div class="line">May this be wash'd in Lethe, and forgotten?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I then did use the person of your father;</div>
                              <div class="line">The image of his power lay then in me:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the administration of his law,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles I was busy for the commonwealth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your highness pleased to forget my place,</div>
                              <div class="line">The majesty and power of law and justice,</div>
                              <div class="line">The image of the king whom I presented,</div>
                              <div class="line">And struck me in my very seat of judgment;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereon, as an offender to your father,</div>
                              <div class="line">I gave bold way to my authority</div>
                              <div class="line">And did commit you. If the deed were ill,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be you contented, wearing now the garland,</div>
                              <div class="line">To have a son set your decrees at nought,</div>
                              <div class="line">To pluck down justice from your awful bench,</div>
                              <div class="line">To trip the course of law and blunt the sword</div>
                              <div class="line">That guards the peace and safety of your person;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, more, to spurn at your most royal image</div>
                              <div class="line">And mock your workings in a second body.</div>
                              <div class="line">Question your royal thoughts, make the case yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">Be now the father and propose a son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear your own dignity so much profaned,</div>
                              <div class="line">See your most dreadful laws so loosely slighted,</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold yourself so by a son disdain'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then imagine me taking your part</div>
                              <div class="line">And in your power soft silencing your son:</div>
                              <div class="line">After this cold considerance, sentence me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as you are a king, speak in your state</div>
                              <div class="line">What I have done that misbecame my place,</div>
                              <div class="line">My person, or my liege's sovereignty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY V</div>
                              <div class="line">You are right, justice, and you weigh this well;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore still bear the balance and the sword:</div>
                              <div class="line">And I do wish your honours may increase,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till you do live to see a son of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Offend you and obey you, as I did.</div>
                              <div class="line">So shall I live to speak my father's words:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Happy am I, that have a man so bold,</div>
                              <div class="line">That dares do justice on my proper son;</div>
                              <div class="line">And not less happy, having such a son,</div>
                              <div class="line">That would deliver up his greatness so</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the hands of justice.' You did commit me:</div>
                              <div class="line">For which, I do commit into your hand</div>
                              <div class="line">The unstained sword that you have used to bear;</div>
                              <div class="line">With this remembrance, that you use the same</div>
                              <div class="line">With the like bold, just and impartial spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">As you have done 'gainst me. There is my hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall be as a father to my youth:</div>
                              <div class="line">My voice shall sound as you do prompt mine ear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will stoop and humble my intents</div>
                              <div class="line">To your well-practised wise directions.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, princes all, believe me, I beseech you;</div>
                              <div class="line">My father is gone wild into his grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">For in his tomb lie my affections;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with his spirit sadly I survive,</div>
                              <div class="line">To mock the expectation of the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">To frustrate prophecies and to raze out</div>
                              <div class="line">Rotten opinion, who hath writ me down</div>
                              <div class="line">After my seeming. The tide of blood in me</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath proudly flow'd in vanity till now:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now doth it turn and ebb back to the sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where it shall mingle with the state of floods</div>
                              <div class="line">And flow henceforth in formal majesty.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now call we our high court of parliament:</div>
                              <div class="line">And let us choose such limbs of noble counsel,</div>
                              <div class="line">That the great body of our state may go</div>
                              <div class="line">In equal rank with the best govern'd nation;</div>
                              <div class="line">That war, or peace, or both at once, may be</div>
                              <div class="line">As things acquainted and familiar to us;</div>
                              <div class="line">In which you, father, shall have foremost hand.</div>
                              <div class="line">Our coronation done, we will accite,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I before remember'd, all our state:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, God consigning to my good intents,</div>
                              <div class="line">No prince nor peer shall have just cause to say,</div>
                              <div class="line">God shorten Harry's happy life one day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S orchard.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter FALSTAFF, SHALLOW, SILENCE, DAVY, BARDOLPH,
and the Page</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, you shall see my orchard, where, in an arbour,</div>
                              <div class="line">we will eat a last year's pippin of my own graffing,</div>
                              <div class="line">with a dish of caraways, and so forth: come,</div>
                              <div class="line">cousin Silence: and then to bed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">'Fore God, you have here a goodly dwelling and a rich.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Barren, barren, barren; beggars all, beggars all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John: marry, good air. Spread, Davy; spread,</div>
                              <div class="line">Davy; well said, Davy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">This Davy serves you for good uses; he is your</div>
                              <div class="line">serving-man and your husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">A good varlet, a good varlet, a very good varlet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John: by the mass, I have drunk too much sack</div>
                              <div class="line">at supper: a good varlet. Now sit down, now sit</div>
                              <div class="line">down: come, cousin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, sirrah! quoth-a, we shall</div>
                              <div class="line">Do nothing but eat, and make good cheer,</div>
                              <p>Singing</p>
                              <div class="line">And praise God for the merry year;</div>
                              <div class="line">When flesh is cheap and females dear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lusty lads roam here and there</div>
                              <div class="line">So merrily,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ever among so merrily.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a merry heart! Good Master Silence, I'll</div>
                              <div class="line">give you a health for that anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Give Master Bardolph some wine, Davy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet sir, sit; I'll be with you anon. most sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">sir, sit. Master page, good master page, sit.</div>
                              <div class="line">Proface! What you want in meat, we'll have in drink:</div>
                              <div class="line">but you must bear; the heart's all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Be merry, Master Bardolph; and, my little soldier</div>
                              <div class="line">there, be merry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Be merry, be merry, my wife has all;</div>
                              <p>Singing</p>
                              <div class="line">For women are shrews, both short and tall:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis merry in hall when beards wag all,</div>
                              <div class="line">And welcome merry Shrove-tide.</div>
                              <div class="line">Be merry, be merry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I did not think Master Silence had been a man of</div>
                              <div class="line">this mettle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, I? I have been merry twice and once ere now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter DAVY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a dish of leather-coats for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>To BARDOLPH</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Davy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worship! I'll be with you straight.</div>
                              <p>To BARDOLPH</p>
                              <div class="line">A cup of wine, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">A cup of wine that's brisk and fine,</div>
                              <p>Singing</p>
                              <div class="line">And drink unto the leman mine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And a merry heart lives long-a.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Well said, Master Silence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">An we shall be merry, now comes in the sweet o' the night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Health and long life to you, Master Silence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Fill the cup, and let it come;</div>
                              <p>Singing</p>
                              <div class="line">I'll pledge you a mile to the bottom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Honest Bardolph, welcome: if thou wantest any</div>
                              <div class="line">thing, and wilt not call, beshrew thy heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome, my little tiny thief.</div>
                              <p>To the Page</p>
                              <div class="line">And welcome indeed too. I'll drink to Master</div>
                              <div class="line">Bardolph, and to all the cavaleros about London.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">I hove to see London once ere I die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">An I might see you there, Davy,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">By the mass, you'll crack a quart together, ha!</div>
                              <div class="line">Will you not, Master Bardolph?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, sir, in a pottle-pot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">By God's liggens, I thank thee: the knave will</div>
                              <div class="line">stick by thee, I can assure thee that. A' will not</div>
                              <div class="line">out; he is true bred.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">And I'll stick by him, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, there spoke a king. Lack nothing: be merry.</div>
                              <p>Knocking within</p>
                              <div class="line">Look who's at door there, ho! who knocks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit DAVY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, now you have done me right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>To SILENCE, seeing him take off a bumper</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Singing</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Do me right,</div>
                              <div class="line">And dub me knight: Samingo.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't not so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Is't so? Why then, say an old man can do somewhat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter DAVY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DAVY</div>
                              <div class="line">An't please your worship, there's one Pistol come</div>
                              <div class="line">from the court with news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">From the court! let him come in.</div>
                              <p>Enter PISTOL</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, Pistol!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John, God save you!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">What wind blew you hither, Pistol?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Not the ill wind which blows no man to good. Sweet</div>
                              <div class="line">knight, thou art now one of the greatest men in this realm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">By'r lady, I think a' be, but goodman Puff of Barson.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Puff!</div>
                              <div class="line">Puff in thy teeth, most recreant coward base!</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John, I am thy Pistol and thy friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And helter-skelter have I rode to thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tidings do I bring and lucky joys</div>
                              <div class="line">And golden times and happy news of price.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee now, deliver them like a man of this world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">A foutre for the world and worldlings base!</div>
                              <div class="line">I speak of Africa and golden joys.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">O base Assyrian knight, what is thy news?</div>
                              <div class="line">Let King Cophetua know the truth thereof.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">And Robin Hood, Scarlet, and John.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Singing</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall dunghill curs confront the Helicons?</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall good news be baffled?</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, Pistol, lay thy head in Furies' lap.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SILENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Honest gentleman, I know not your breeding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then, lament therefore.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me pardon, sir: if, sir, you come with news</div>
                              <div class="line">from the court, I take it there's but two ways,</div>
                              <div class="line">either to utter them, or to conceal them. I am,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir, under the king, in some authority.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Under which king, Besonian? speak, or die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Under King Harry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry the Fourth? or Fifth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry the Fourth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">A foutre for thine office!</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir John, thy tender lambkin now is king;</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry the Fifth's the man. I speak the truth:</div>
                              <div class="line">When Pistol lies, do this; and fig me, like</div>
                              <div class="line">The bragging Spaniard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">What, is the old king dead?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">As nail in door: the things I speak are just.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, Bardolph! saddle my horse. Master Robert</div>
                              <div class="line">Shallow, choose what office thou wilt in the land,</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis thine. Pistol, I will double-charge thee with dignities.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BARDOLPH</div>
                              <div class="line">O joyful day!</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not take a knighthood for my fortune.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">What! I do bring good news.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Carry Master Silence to bed. Master Shallow, my</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Shallow,--be what thou wilt; I am fortune's</div>
                              <div class="line">steward--get on thy boots: we'll ride all night.</div>
                              <div class="line">O sweet Pistol! Away, Bardolph!</div>
                              <p>Exit BARDOLPH</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, Pistol, utter more to me; and withal devise</div>
                              <div class="line">something to do thyself good. Boot, boot, Master</div>
                              <div class="line">Shallow: I know the young king is sick for me. Let</div>
                              <div class="line">us take any man's horses; the laws of England are at</div>
                              <div class="line">my commandment. Blessed are they that have been my</div>
                              <div class="line">friends; and woe to my lord chief-justice!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Let vultures vile seize on his lungs also!</div>
                              <div class="line">'Where is the life that late I led?' say they:</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, here it is; welcome these pleasant days!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  London. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter Beadles, dragging in HOSTESS QUICKLY
and DOLL TEARSHEET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                              <div class="line">No, thou arrant knave; I would to God that I might</div>
                              <div class="line">die, that I might have thee hanged: thou hast</div>
                              <div class="line">drawn my shoulder out of joint.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Beadle</div>
                              <div class="line">The constables have delivered her over to me; and</div>
                              <div class="line">she shall have whipping-cheer enough, I warrant</div>
                              <div class="line">her: there hath been a man or two lately killed about her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nut-hook, nut-hook, you lie. Come on; I 'll tell</div>
                              <div class="line">thee what, thou damned tripe-visaged rascal, an</div>
                              <div class="line">the child I now go with do miscarry, thou wert</div>
                              <div class="line">better thou hadst struck thy mother, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">paper-faced villain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                              <div class="line">O the Lord, that Sir John were come! he would make</div>
                              <div class="line">this a bloody day to somebody. But I pray God the</div>
                              <div class="line">fruit of her womb miscarry!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Beadle</div>
                              <div class="line">If it do, you shall have a dozen of cushions again;</div>
                              <div class="line">you have but eleven now. Come, I charge you both go</div>
                              <div class="line">with me; for the man is dead that you and Pistol</div>
                              <div class="line">beat amongst you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell you what, you thin man in a censer, I</div>
                              <div class="line">will have you as soundly swinged for this,--you</div>
                              <div class="line">blue-bottle rogue, you filthy famished correctioner,</div>
                              <div class="line">if you be not swinged, I'll forswear half-kirtles.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Beadle</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, you she knight-errant, come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, that right should thus overcome might!</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, of sufferance comes ease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, you rogue, come; bring me to a justice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, come, you starved blood-hound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                              <div class="line">Goodman death, goodman bones!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MISTRESS QUICKLY</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou atomy, thou!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DOLL TEARSHEET</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, you thin thing; come you rascal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Beadle</div>
                              <div class="line">Very well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter two Grooms, strewing rushes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Groom</div>
                              <div class="line">More rushes, more rushes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Groom</div>
                              <div class="line">The trumpets have sounded twice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Groom</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twill be two o'clock ere they come from the</div>
                              <div class="line">coronation: dispatch, dispatch.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Enter FALSTAFF, SHALLOW, PISTOL,
BARDOLPH, and Page</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand here by me, Master Robert Shallow; I will</div>
                              <div class="line">make the king do you grace: I will leer upon him as</div>
                              <div class="line">a' comes by; and do but mark the countenance that he</div>
                              <div class="line">will give me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">God bless thy lungs, good knight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Come here, Pistol; stand behind me. O, if I had had</div>
                              <div class="line">time to have made new liveries, I would have</div>
                              <div class="line">bestowed the thousand pound I borrowed of you. But</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis no matter; this poor show doth better: this</div>
                              <div class="line">doth infer the zeal I had to see him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">It doth so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">It shows my earnestness of affection,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">It doth so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My devotion,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">It doth, it doth, it doth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">As it were, to ride day and night; and not to</div>
                              <div class="line">deliberate, not to remember, not to have patience</div>
                              <div class="line">to shift me,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">It is best, certain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">But to stand stained with travel, and sweating with</div>
                              <div class="line">desire to see him; thinking of nothing else,</div>
                              <div class="line">putting all affairs else in oblivion, as if there</div>
                              <div class="line">were nothing else to be done but to see him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis 'semper idem,' for 'obsque hoc nihil est:'</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis all in every part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis so, indeed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">My knight, I will inflame thy noble liver,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make thee rage.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy Doll, and Helen of thy noble thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is in base durance and contagious prison;</div>
                              <div class="line">Haled thither</div>
                              <div class="line">By most mechanical and dirty hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">Rouse up revenge from ebon den with fell</div>
                              <div class="line">Alecto's snake,</div>
                              <div class="line">For Doll is in. Pistol speaks nought but truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">I will deliver her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Shouts within, and the trumpets sound</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">There roar'd the sea, and trumpet-clangor sounds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING HENRY V and his train, the Lord Chief-
Justice among them</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">God save thy grace, King Hal! my royal Hal!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">The heavens thee guard and keep, most royal imp of fame!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">God save thee, my sweet boy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord chief-justice, speak to that vain man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you your wits? know you what 'tis to speak?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My king! my Jove! I speak to thee, my heart!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY IV</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thee not, old man: fall to thy prayers;</div>
                              <div class="line">How ill white hairs become a fool and jester!</div>
                              <div class="line">I have long dream'd of such a kind of man,</div>
                              <div class="line">So surfeit-swell'd, so old and so profane;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, being awaked, I do despise my dream.</div>
                              <div class="line">Make less thy body hence, and more thy grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave gormandizing; know the grave doth gape</div>
                              <div class="line">For thee thrice wider than for other men.</div>
                              <div class="line">Reply not to me with a fool-born jest:</div>
                              <div class="line">Presume not that I am the thing I was;</div>
                              <div class="line">For God doth know, so shall the world perceive,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I have turn'd away my former self;</div>
                              <div class="line">So will I those that kept me company.</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou dost hear I am as I have been,</div>
                              <div class="line">Approach me, and thou shalt be as thou wast,</div>
                              <div class="line">The tutor and the feeder of my riots:</div>
                              <div class="line">Till then, I banish thee, on pain of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I have done the rest of my misleaders,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to come near our person by ten mile.</div>
                              <div class="line">For competence of life I will allow you,</div>
                              <div class="line">That lack of means enforce you not to evil:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as we hear you do reform yourselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">We will, according to your strengths and qualities,</div>
                              <div class="line">Give you advancement. Be it your charge, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see perform'd the tenor of our word. Set on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt KING HENRY V, &c</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Master Shallow, I owe you a thousand pound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, marry, Sir John; which I beseech you to let me</div>
                              <div class="line">have home with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">That can hardly be, Master Shallow. Do not you</div>
                              <div class="line">grieve at this; I shall be sent for in private to</div>
                              <div class="line">him: look you, he must seem thus to the world:</div>
                              <div class="line">fear not your advancements; I will be the man yet</div>
                              <div class="line">that shall make you great.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot well perceive how, unless you should give</div>
                              <div class="line">me your doublet and stuff me out with straw. I</div>
                              <div class="line">beseech you, good Sir John, let me have five hundred</div>
                              <div class="line">of my thousand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I will be as good as my word: this that you</div>
                              <div class="line">heard was but a colour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHALLOW</div>
                              <div class="line">A colour that I fear you will die in, Sir John.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear no colours: go with me to dinner: come,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lieutenant Pistol; come, Bardolph: I shall be sent</div>
                              <div class="line">for soon at night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter Prince John of LANCASTER, the Lord
Chief-Justice; Officers with them</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, carry Sir John Falstaff to the Fleet:</div>
                              <div class="line">Take all his company along with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FALSTAFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, my lord,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot now speak: I will hear you soon.</div>
                              <div class="line">Take them away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PISTOL</div>
                              <div class="line">Si fortune me tormenta, spero contenta.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but PRINCE JOHN and the Lord
Chief-Justice</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I like this fair proceeding of the king's:</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath intent his wonted followers</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall all be very well provided for;</div>
                              <div class="line">But all are banish'd till their conversations</div>
                              <div class="line">Appear more wise and modest to the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">And so they are.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath call'd his parliament, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Chief-Justice</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LANCASTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I will lay odds that, ere this year expire,</div>
                              <div class="line">We bear our civil swords and native fire</div>
                              <div class="line">As far as France: I heard a bird so sing,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose music, to my thinking, pleased the king.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, will you hence?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.8.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. EPILOGUE</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Spoken by a Dancer</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker"/>
                              <div class="line">First my fear; then my courtesy; last my speech.</div>
                              <div class="line">My fear is, your displeasure; my courtesy, my duty;</div>
                              <div class="line">and my speech, to beg your pardons. If you look</div>
                              <div class="line">for a good speech now, you undo me: for what I have</div>
                              <div class="line">to say is of mine own making; and what indeed I</div>
                              <div class="line">should say will, I doubt, prove mine own marring.</div>
                              <div class="line">But to the purpose, and so to the venture. Be it</div>
                              <div class="line">known to you, as it is very well, I was lately here</div>
                              <div class="line">in the end of a displeasing play, to pray your</div>
                              <div class="line">patience for it and to promise you a better. I</div>
                              <div class="line">meant indeed to pay you with this; which, if like an</div>
                              <div class="line">ill venture it come unluckily home, I break, and</div>
                              <div class="line">you, my gentle creditors, lose. Here I promised you</div>
                              <div class="line">I would be and here I commit my body to your</div>
                              <div class="line">mercies: bate me some and I will pay you some and,</div>
                              <div class="line">as most debtors do, promise you infinitely.</div>
                              <div class="line">If my tongue cannot entreat you to acquit me, will</div>
                              <div class="line">you command me to use my legs? and yet that were but</div>
                              <div class="line">light payment, to dance out of your debt. But a</div>
                              <div class="line">good conscience will make any possible satisfaction,</div>
                              <div class="line">and so would I. All the gentlewomen here have</div>
                              <div class="line">forgiven me: if the gentlemen will not, then the</div>
                              <div class="line">gentlemen do not agree with the gentlewomen, which</div>
                              <div class="line">was never seen before in such an assembly.</div>
                              <div class="line">One word more, I beseech you. If you be not too</div>
                              <div class="line">much cloyed with fat meat, our humble author will</div>
                              <div class="line">continue the story, with Sir John in it, and make</div>
                              <div class="line">you merry with fair Katharine of France: where, for</div>
                              <div class="line">any thing I know, Falstaff shall die of a sweat,</div>
                              <div class="line">unless already a' be killed with your hard</div>
                              <div class="line">opinions; for Oldcastle died a martyr, and this is</div>
                              <div class="line">not the man. My tongue is weary; when my legs are</div>
                              <div class="line">too, I will bid you good night: and so kneel down</div>
                              <div class="line">before you; but, indeed, to pray for the queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
The “current” CSS styling is applied to the this entire document; the results in this column may be anomalous. Also, image links are broken in this column. 

The Second Part of Henry the Fourth

  • 1. Dramatis Personae

  • 2. ACT I
    • 1. SCENE I. The same.
    • 2. SCENE II. London. A street.
    • 3. SCENE III. York. The Archbishop's palace.
  • 3. ACT II
    • 1. SCENE I. London. A street.
    • 2. SCENE II. London. Another street.
    • 3. SCENE III. Warkworth. Before the castle.
    • 4. SCENE IV. London. The Boar's-head Tavern in Eastcheap.
  • 4. ACT III
    • 1. SCENE I. Westminster. The palace.
    • 2. SCENE II. Gloucestershire. Before SHALLOW'S house.
  • 5. ACT IV
    • 1. SCENE I. Yorkshire. Gaultree Forest.
    • 2. SCENE II. Another part of the forest.
    • 3. SCENE III. Another part of the forest.
    • 4. SCENE IV. Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
    • 5. SCENE V. Another chamber.
  • 6. ACT V
    • 1. SCENE I. Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S house.
    • 2. SCENE II. Westminster. The palace.
    • 3. SCENE III. Gloucestershire. SHALLOW'S orchard.
    • 4. SCENE IV. London. A street.
    • 5. SCENE V. A public place near Westminster Abbey.
    • 6. EPILOGUE

Dramatis Personae

RUMOUR, the Presenter.

KING HENRY, the Fourth.

PRINCE HENRY OF WALES afterwards KING HENRY V. THOMAS, DUKE OF, CLARENCE PRINCE HUMPHREY, OF GLOUCESTER sons of King Henry.

EARL OF WARWICK

EARL OF WESTMORELAND

EARL OF SURREY

GOWER

HARCOURT

BLUNT

Lord Chief-Justice of the King's Bench

A Servant of the Chief-Justice.

EARL OF NORTHUMBERLAND

SCROOP, ARCHBISHOP OF YORK

LORD MOWBRAY

LORD HASTINGS

LORD BARDOLPH

SIR JOHN COLEVILE

TRAVERS MORTON retainers of Northumberland.

SIR JOHN FALSTAFF

His Page.

BARDOLPH

PISTOL

POINS

PETO

SHALLOW SILENCE country justices.

DAVY, servant to Shallow.

MOULDY SHADOW WART FEEBLE BULLCALF recruits.
FANG SNARE sheriff's officers.

LADY NORTHUMBERLAND

LADY PERCY

MISTRESS QUICKLY, hostess of a tavern in Eastcheap.

DOLL TEARSHEET

Lords and Attendants; Porter, Drawers, Beadles, Grooms, &c.

A Dancer, speaker of the epilogue.

SCENE England.

Chapter 1. INDUCTION

Warkworth. Before the castle

Enter RUMOUR, painted full of tongues

RUMOUR
Open your ears; for which of you will stop
The vent of hearing when loud Rumour speaks?
I, from the orient to the drooping west,
Making the wind my post-horse, still unfold
The acts commenced on this ball of earth:
Upon my tongues continual slanders ride,
The which in every language I pronounce,
Stuffing the ears of men with false reports.
I speak of peace, while covert enmity
Under the smile of safety wounds the world:
And who but Rumour, who but only I,
Make fearful musters and prepared defence,
Whiles the big year, swoln with some other grief,
Is thought with child by the stern tyrant war,
And no such matter? Rumour is a pipe
Blown by surmises, jealousies, conjectures
And of so easy and so plain a stop
That the blunt monster with uncounted heads,
The still-discordant wavering multitude,
Can play upon it. But what need I thus
My well-known body to anatomize
Among my household? Why is Rumour here?
I run before King Harry's victory;
Who in a bloody field by Shrewsbury
Hath beaten down young Hotspur and his troops,
Quenching the flame of bold rebellion
Even with the rebel's blood. But what mean I
To speak so true at first? my office is
To noise abroad that Harry Monmouth fell
Under the wrath of noble Hotspur's sword,
And that the king before the Douglas' rage
Stoop'd his anointed head as low as death.
This have I rumour'd through the peasant towns
Between that royal field of Shrewsbury
And this worm-eaten hold of ragged stone,
Where Hotspur's father, old Northumberland,
Lies crafty-sick: the posts come tiring on,
And not a man of them brings other news
Than they have learn'd of me: from Rumour's tongues
They bring smooth comforts false, worse than
true wrongs.

Exit

Chapter 2. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. The same.
  • 2. SCENE II. London. A street.
  • 3. SCENE III. York. The Archbishop's palace.

1. SCENE I. The same.

Enter LORD BARDOLPH

LORD BARDOLPH
Who keeps the gate here, ho?

The Porter opens the gate

Where is the earl?
Porter
What shall I say you are?
LORD BARDOLPH
Tell thou the earl
That the Lord Bardolph doth attend him here.
Porter
His lordship is walk'd forth into the orchard;
Please it your honour, knock but at the gate,
And he himself wilt answer.

Enter NORTHUMBERLAND

LORD BARDOLPH
Here comes the earl.

Exit Porter

NORTHUMBERLAND
What news, Lord Bardolph? every minute now
Should be the father of some stratagem:
The times are wild: contention, like a horse
Full of high feeding, madly hath broke loose
And bears down all before him.
LORD BARDOLPH
Noble earl,
I bring you certain news from Shrewsbury.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Good, an God will!
LORD BARDOLPH
As good as heart can wish:
The king is almost wounded to the death;
And, in the fortune of my lord your son,
Prince Harry slain outright; and both the Blunts
Kill'd by the hand of Douglas; young Prince John
And Westmoreland and Stafford fled the field;
And Harry Monmouth's brawn, the hulk Sir John,
Is prisoner to your son: O, such a day,
So fought, so follow'd and so fairly won,
Came not till now to dignify the times,
Since Caesar's fortunes!
NORTHUMBERLAND
How is this derived?
Saw you the field? came you from Shrewsbury?
LORD BARDOLPH
I spake with one, my lord, that came from thence,
A gentleman well bred and of good name,
That freely render'd me these news for true.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Here comes my servant Travers, whom I sent
On Tuesday last to listen after news.

Enter TRAVERS

LORD BARDOLPH
My lord, I over-rode him on the way;
And he is furnish'd with no certainties
More than he haply may retail from me.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Now, Travers, what good tidings comes with you?
TRAVERS
My lord, Sir John Umfrevile turn'd me back
With joyful tidings; and, being better horsed,
Out-rode me. After him came spurring hard
A gentleman, almost forspent with speed,
That stopp'd by me to breathe his bloodied horse.
He ask'd the way to Chester; and of him
I did demand what news from Shrewsbury:
He told me that rebellion had bad luck
And that young Harry Percy's spur was cold.
With that, he gave his able horse the head,
And bending forward struck his armed heels
Against the panting sides of his poor jade
Up to the rowel-head, and starting so
He seem'd in running to devour the way,
Staying no longer question.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Ha! Again:
Said he young Harry Percy's spur was cold?
Of Hotspur Coldspur? that rebellion
Had met ill luck?
LORD BARDOLPH
My lord, I'll tell you what;
If my young lord your son have not the day,
Upon mine honour, for a silken point
I'll give my barony: never talk of it.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Why should that gentleman that rode by Travers
Give then such instances of loss?
LORD BARDOLPH
Who, he?
He was some hilding fellow that had stolen
The horse he rode on, and, upon my life,
Spoke at a venture. Look, here comes more news.

Enter MORTON

NORTHUMBERLAND
Yea, this man's brow, like to a title-leaf,
Foretells the nature of a tragic volume:
So looks the strand whereon the imperious flood
Hath left a witness'd usurpation.
Say, Morton, didst thou come from Shrewsbury?
MORTON
I ran from Shrewsbury, my noble lord;
Where hateful death put on his ugliest mask
To fright our party.
NORTHUMBERLAND
How doth my son and brother?
Thou tremblest; and the whiteness in thy cheek
Is apter than thy tongue to tell thy errand.
Even such a man, so faint, so spiritless,
So dull, so dead in look, so woe-begone,
Drew Priam's curtain in the dead of night,
And would have told him half his Troy was burnt;
But Priam found the fire ere he his tongue,
And I my Percy's death ere thou report'st it.
This thou wouldst say, 'Your son did thus and thus;
Your brother thus: so fought the noble Douglas:'
Stopping my greedy ear with their bold deeds:
But in the end, to stop my ear indeed,
Thou hast a sigh to blow away this praise,
Ending with 'Brother, son, and all are dead.'
MORTON
Douglas is living, and your brother, yet;
But, for my lord your son--
NORTHUMBERLAND
Why, he is dead.
See what a ready tongue suspicion hath!
He that but fears the thing he would not know
Hath by instinct knowledge from others' eyes
That what he fear'd is chanced. Yet speak, Morton;
Tell thou an earl his divination lies,
And I will take it as a sweet disgrace
And make thee rich for doing me such wrong.
MORTON
You are too great to be by me gainsaid:
Your spirit is too true, your fears too certain.
NORTHUMBERLAND
Yet, for all this, say not that Percy's dead.
I see a strange confession in thine eye:
Thou shakest thy head and hold'st it fear or sin
To speak a truth. If he be slain, say so;
The tongue offends not that reports his death:
And he doth sin that doth belie the dead,
Not he which says the dead is not alive.
Yet the first bringer of unwelcome news
Hath but a losing office, and his tongue
Sounds ever after as a sullen bell,
Remember'd tolling a departing friend.
LORD BARDOLPH
I cannot think, my lord, your son is dead.
MORTON
I am sorry I should force you to believe
That which I would to God I had not seen;
But these mine eyes saw him in bloody state,
Rendering faint quittance, wearied and out-breathed,
To Harry Monmouth; whose swift wrath beat down
The never-daunted Percy to the earth,
From whence with life he never more sprung up.
In few, his death, whose spirit lent a fire
Even to the dullest peasant in his camp,
Being bruited once, took fire and heat away
From the best temper'd courage in his troops;
For from his metal was his party steel'd;
Which once in him abated, all the rest
Turn'd on themselves, like dull and heavy lead:
And as the thing that's heavy in itself,
Upon enforcement flies with greatest speed,
So did our men, heavy in Hotspur's loss,
Lend to this weight such lightness with their fear
That arrows fled not swifter toward their aim
Than did our soldiers, aiming at their safety,
Fly from the field. Then was the noble Worcester
Too soon ta'en prisoner; and that furious Scot,
The bloody Douglas, whose well-labouring sword
Had three times slain the appearance of the king,
'Gan vail his stomach and did grace the shame
Of those that turn'd their backs, and in his flight,
Stumbling in fear, was took. The sum of all
Is that the king hath won, and hath sent out
A speedy power to encounter you, my lord,
Under the conduct of young Lancaster
And Westmoreland. This is the news at full.
NORTHUMBERLAND
For this I shall have time enough to mourn.
In poison there is physic; and these news,
Having been well, that would have made me sick,
Being sick, have in some measure made me well:
And as the wretch, whose fever-weaken'd joints,
Like strengthless hinges, buckle under life,
Impatient of his fit, breaks like a fire
Out of his keeper's arms, even so my limbs,
Weaken'd with grief, being now enraged with grief,
Are thrice themselves. Hence, therefore, thou nice crutch!
A scaly gauntlet now with joints of steel
Must glove this hand: and hence, thou sickly quoif!
Thou art a guard too wanton for the head
Which princes, flesh'd with conquest, aim to hit.
Now bind my brows with iron; and approach
The ragged'st hour that time and spite dare bring
To frown upon the enraged Northumberland!
Let heaven kiss earth! now let not Nature's hand
Keep the wild flood confined! let order die!
And let this world no longer be a stage
To feed contention in a lingering act;
But let one spirit of the first-born Cain
Reign in all bosoms, that, each heart being set
On bloody courses, the rude scene may end,
And darkness be the burier of the dead!
TRAVERS
This strained passion doth you wrong, my lord.
LORD BARDOLPH
Sweet earl, divorce not wisdom from your honour.
MORTON
The lives of all your loving complices
Lean on your health; the which, if you give o'er
To stormy passion, must perforce decay.
You cast the event of war, my noble lord,
And summ'd the account of chance, before you said
'Let us make head.' It was your presurmise,
That, in the dole of blows, your son might drop:
You knew he walk'd o'er perils, on an edge,
More likely to fall in than to get o'er;
You were advised his flesh was capable
Of wounds and scars and that his forward spirit
Would lift him where most trade of danger ranged:
Yet did you say 'Go forth;' and none of this,
Though strongly apprehended, could restrain
The stiff-borne action: what hath then befallen,
Or what hath this bold enterprise brought forth,
More than that being which was like to be?
LORD BARDOLPH
We all that are engaged to this loss
Knew that we ventured on such dangerous seas
That if we wrought our life 'twas ten to one;
And yet we ventured, for the gain proposed
Choked the respect of likely peril fear'd;
And since we are o'erset, venture again.
Come, we will all put forth, body and goods.
MORTON
